193501.name: Metal Slug X
193501.description:
An upgraded version of Metal Slug 2, titled Metal Slug X, was released in March 1999 for the Neo Geo MVS. It fixed slowdown problems from the original game, and increased the difficulty. Metal Slug X also introduced some new elements to the game system;


Much of the music has been remixed or altered.
Many stages have the time of day changed. Instead of individual levels being set at either day or night, the stages can take place at dusk, twilight, or sunset.
It is now possible for the player character to become fat by collecting food items in every stage after Mission 2; in the original game, the obese transformation was only possible in Mission 4.
All levels contain an increased enemy count and new enemy placements, as well as different enemy characters, and new boss placements.
Vehicle types and locations are different.
There are more power-ups, POWs, and items (particularly food) in each mission. These items are often hidden.
Many environmental elements have different reactions when shot, such as exploding with unexpected results or randomly spewing out items or enemies.
Stronger versions like the heavy machine gun, flameshot, shotgun, laser rifle, and rocket launcher are available. Each deals more damage than their normal counterpart, has a different appearance and a wider (or longer) area of impact. If the player happens to be fat while using these heavier weapons, they appear differently and can cause even more damage.
Several new weapons are included: Stones, Iron Lizard, Enemy Chaser, Super Grenade, Drop Shot, and a new Golden Metal Slug, which is available in Mission 3.
Added Fio's death sound (In Metal Slug 2, she uses Eri's)
The original art for Metal Slug is shown at the end of the game while the credits are rolling, instead of the black screen used in Metal Slug 2.


Source: Wikipedia, "Metal Slug 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193502.name: The Oracle
193502.description:
From publisher blurb:

The world is like folded cloth overflowing with patterns. Patterns hiding other patterns, patterns on top of other patterns, patterns within patterns and they all can be seen if you pay attention. You will see them in the flight of birds, in the lines on someone else’s hands, in the entrails of animals, or in the unique patterns of your very soul. I was born with this gift, but you, you have been chosen by the spirits. With time and their guidance you will learn to see what is and what was, and as your powers grow stronger, you will also see what will be. Pick up the cloth called life and in the patterns below, you will see the spirits that once dwelled there and you’ll be able to call them forth, inhibiting your body to provide answers, you will be able to give courage to young heroes by showing them the outcome of their good deeds or instill fear in your enemies by plaguing their minds with the horrible future that awaits them if they dare oppose you and your companions. Seer, medium, psychic, augur, diviner, channeller, soothsayer, oracle… people will call you by many names and they will love and hate you for your gifts but you must always remember one thing: In order to grow, you must understand everything around you, even those who seek to do you harm. To understand is to divine patterns.

This product contains two files:

A 16 page playbook containing 21 moves, some gear and magic items.
The Catari, a new race with custom moves for you to use.
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

193503.name: Trade Hub
193503.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a large trade hub with docking bays for well over one hundred ships of various sizes.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

193504.name: Dark Tower
193504.description:
From the back cover:

An Ancient Evil has overtaken a once holy shrine. Thus, a sleepy mountain hamlet becomes a focal point for mysterious disappearances and even stranger legends of what lurks beneath the village.

Would any group of adventurous souls dare to probe the facts that lie behind the myths, or seek to right ancient wrongs, rescue secreted artifacts, or . . . even attempt to exterminate the source of evil itself?

This is no quest for the weak of spirit or strength. Beyond the cellars of Mitra's Fist lie strong allies and strange enemies, undead and undying, each seeking to involve the unwary in a titanic battle of good against evil, which can only end in destruction.

Riches, Power, Glory and Death!
All are in Dark Tower

193505.name: Treasure
193505.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Companion II: Treasure contains a large number of magical items of treasure and a sample system for randomly determining what treasure is a given group of monsters has. With the publication of this Microlite74 3.0 Companion volume, Microlite74 becomes a complete and self-contained system with no need for the SRD or reference to other old school rules. This volume includes any classic treasure items as well as a few new items designed for the Microlite74 system. Microlite74 Companion II: Treasure can be used with any of the three versions of Microlite74: Basic, Standard, or Extended.

193506.name: More Optional Rules
193506.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Companion III: More Optional Rules contains a large number of optional rules a GM may elect to include in a campaign. Each optional rules section is independent and can be included or excluded on its own. Most optional rules are usable with any of the three versions of Microlite74: Basic, Standard, or Extended.

This book includes optional rules for:

Additional races and classes
Race as class
Witch class and spell list
Necromancer class and spell list
Shaman class and spell list
Thaumaturge class and spell list
Additional monsters
Spell Spheres
Traps
Additional combat rules and much more

193507.name: Bestiary of Monsters
193507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Companion IV: Bestiary of Monsters contains descriptions of a large number of 0e and 1e monsters, including demons and devils. These descriptions are much more detailed than those included in the Microlite74 rules including descriptions and treasure types. These monsters are usable with any of the three versions of Microlite74: Basic, Standard, or Extended.

193508.name: Candy Heist: The Sweet d16 RPG

rpg.33947: Candy Heist: The Sweet d16 RPG

193508.description:
From the game text

Candy Heist is a short, light-hearted tabletop roleplaying game for two or more players in which you will create a heist story of intelligent animals trying to steal sweets from the biggest sweets store in town. You can set your story in our modern day world, in a medieval fantasy setting, on a space station, or wherever you can imagine a wondrous shop full of tasty confectionery.

193509.name: First Edition Spells
193509.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Companion V: First Edition Spells provides more detailed descriptions of spells and provides many new spells similar to those in the first edition of the world’s most popular fantasy RPG. Using the spells in this companion volume instead of the ones in the Microlite74 Standard or Extended rules will make your game more similar the First Edition (1e) than the Original Edition (0e), especially when combined with monsters from Microlite74 Companion IV: Bestiary of Monsters. Most of these spells are suitable for use with either the Standard or Extended versions of Microlite74. With care some can be used with the Basic version of Microlite74. Healing spells list alternative effects for the Basic/Standard hit point system and for the Extended hit point/body point system.

193510.name: Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls Gamemaster Screen
193510.description:
Gamemasters Screen for Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls. 6 pages set up so you can tape them together and stand them up.

Source: User (Ken St. Andre) summary.

193511.name: An Axe to Grind
193511.description:
Publishers Blurb:

The frontier town of Ehrshire is expanding rapidly, much to the delight of the burgeoning town’s lord, Earl Wallace Viktir. In need of timber to expand his seat of power, the earl has sent logging crews to the surrounding forest, although recent delays have caused him to become anxious and impulsive. Earl Viktir has left for the logging site to see what is causing the setbacks, only to discover it disturbingly vacant!

The task now falls to the PCs to catch up with the missing Earl Viktir and sort out the trouble in the woods, but such as task is easier said than done. Something has roused the local plant-life into a frenzy, as if the entire forest has an axe to grind against the loggers! Will the party be able to get to the root of the problem… or will they be left barking up the wrong tree?

An Axe to Grind is part of Dungeons on Demand: Volume Three.

193512.description:
From the publisher (Translated):
The world has descended into chaos. Ancient powers are emerging from the shadows; legendary entities awaken from their stagnation… men’s time is in danger. Greytower is the last hallow that stands against the chaos. The salvation of the kingdom lies almost within reach thanks to its brave knights. Join them and rise to become the greatest hero there has ever been!

GOAL OF THE GAME
Each player assumes the role of a hero from Greytower. They will acquire fame in the shape of victory points by solving adventures, completing deeds and joining forces to defeat the hordes of chaos. The player who obtains the most points at the end will win, rising as the greatest hero of all time.

From the publisher (Spanish):
El mundo se sume en el caos, poderes antiguos surgen de entre las sombras, seres legendarios despiertan de su letargo...
...el tiempo de los hombres peligra.
Greytower es el último bastión que se resiste al poder del caos.
Gracias a sus valerosos caballeros la salvación del reino está cada día mas cerca. Únete a ellos y álzate como el mayor héroe que haya existido...

OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO
Cada jugador asumirá el papel de un héroe de Greytower.
Resolviendo Aventuras, completando Gestas y colaborando en la derrota de la Horda del caos los jugadores irán adquiriendo fama
(Puntos de victoria).
Al final del juego el jugador con más puntos se proclamará ganador, alzándose como el mayor héroe de todos los tiempos...
193512.name: Kingdom Defenders

193513.description:
In Legendary, players take on the roles of Marvel heroes, including the Avengers and X-Men, and team up to defeat an evil Mastermind. Legendary: Civil War is the fourth big box expansion since the Dark City release in 2013 and lets you play through the Civil War storyline from Marvel Comics!

Legendary: Civil War features heroes from Captain America's Anti-Registration group including Falcon, Hercules, Tigra, and even the Pet Avengers Sidekick cards

The new split Hero cards give players the ability to 'chose a side'!
193513.name: Legendary: Civil War

129437.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

193516.name: Eiyuu Senki: The World Conquest

videogamehonor.33949: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Download Only Game of the Year Winner

193516.description:
User Summary

The player finds himself in an alternate world populated with famous characters in history and legend - who all happen to be beautiful women - and must fight his way to world domination.

193517.name: Track Suit Manager

videogameversion.300507: English / European Amstrad CPC (Hi-Tec Software re-release) Cassette edition

193517.description:
From the back of the box:

A MANAGER GAME THE WAY IT SHOULD BE PLAYED

IGNORE FINANCE ... you are not an accountant.
FORGET ADMINISTRATION ... get a secretary.

YOU ARE A 'TRACK SUIT' MANAGER SO GET OUT WITH THE LADS

You decide the play so you can enjoy the victories or suffer the defeats as you Play Defence, Attacking, Zonal or man to man marking, offside trap, sweeper system, possession football and so much more. Live the match thrills with GENUINE goalkicks, corners, throw ins, crunching tackles, fouls, penalties, bookings and sending offs as you compete to qualify for the NATIONS and WORLD cups.

This game gives you everything 'plus' more from the GIANTS of Software specialising in games more...

INVOLVED (Monthly Diaries, superb scouting reports, match dates etc.)
ADVANCED (54 Computer managed squads from around the World, all with individual tactics)
ORIGINAL (Real match tactics, extra time, authentic newspaper reports)

... than other football games.

193518.name: Persona 4: Dancing All Night

videogamehonor.34544: 2015 Golden Geek Best PS Vita Game Nominee

193518.description:
The story is retold to the player by Margaret, and takes place roughly a month after the epilogue of Persona 4 Golden. Since then, Rise Kujikawa has returned to the world of entertainment, and is teaching her friends from Inaba how to dance so they can act as her backup dancers in a live performance at the Love Meets Bonds Festival. Yu Narukami, now living in the city, meets up with Rise and Naoto Shirogane to practice, but they are informed by festival producer Kyoka Uchimizu that Rise's friends will no longer be performing and that Rise will instead be singing alongside her junior idol Kanami Mashita.

Source: Wikipedia, "Persona 4: Dancing All Night", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193519.name: Convoy Raider

videogameversion.300515: English / European Amstrad CPC 3" Disk edition

193519.description:
From the back of the box:

The free world is in peril - war has been declared and the enemy is closing in. Your weakest point is the coastline so a strategic defence initiative has been adopted.

Your mission - is to patrol and defend the inner sea using all the modern weapons systems with which you have been supplied.

Seawolf - a deadly accurate missile for use against both aeroplane and anti-ship missiles.

Exocet - a video linked rocket for attack upon surface ships.

Anti Submarine Helicopter - attach the enemy submarines using your depth charges.

The future of the country lies in your hands; frighteningly powerful weapons are at your disposal and important decisions must be made.

User Summary

Convoy Raider is a simulation of a modern (presumably British, given the weapon loadout) naval vessel tasked with patrolling the local waters with an aim of finding and sinking enemy ships and submarines. Of course the ships and submarines shoot back, and are augmented with aircraft which also threaten your ship.

The player can understand the immediate tactical situation using a Radar screen. This is in two parts, with the top showing surface and aerial threats, and the bottom showing submarines. More widely, the Map view allows your ship to be moved and also shows enemies.

You are armed with two types of guided missiles - the Seawolf for aeroplanes and incoming missiles, and the Exocet for attacking enemy shipping. Missiles must be remotely steered to their targets, then as they get close, the correct target on the horizon must be selected.

The helicopter can be used to attack submarines with depth charges, however the submarine can retaliate with surface-to-air missiles.

Damage is shown on a silhouette of your ship and can be repaired by rendezvousing with a repair ship. The manual helpfully states "Colliding with land causes extensive damage".

193520.name: TeraBlaster
193520.description:
Take control of a rogue ship and and wage war against endless waves of foes in TeraBlaster! Featuring classic top-down shooter mechanics and smooth addictive gameplay, TeraBlaster will put your reflexes to the test while you hurl gamma-grenades against your foes.

Features:

Explore procedurally generated environments
Ruthlessly destroy hordes of enemy spacecraft
Experience endless compelling gameplay
Engage with the philosophical and quirky backstory
Treat your ears to the gloriously retro OST

Source: The Publisher Website.

193521.name: Hordelicious
193521.description:
Get ready to rock! Hordelicious is a semi-hardcore wave based arena shooter. Survive against endless hordes of enemies with over 45 randomly looted weapons and a plethora of items and upgrades to choose from!
Your original mission was to explore the new planet we found. We knew about the life forms of the planet, but what we didn’t know was that these creatures actually worship the planet itself. Now we have disgraced their holy ground with our human feet and angered the creatures of this planet. You have to forget our original plans and fight your way out of there!

Features:
Over 45 unique weapons
A plethora of items of upgrades
Epic boss battles
Achievements to unlock
Levels with multiple variations

Source: The Publisher Website.

193522.name: Zombie Party
193522.description:
Go on a Time Traveling Multi-Dimensional Adventure alone or with your Friends! Zombie Party is an Intense Action RPG Shoot-em-up Experience with Creative Weaponry and a Modular Weapon Building System! Fight hordes of enemies. Battle ferocious and unrelenting bosses. Build phenomenal guns! Shoot rainbow laserbeams! Launch incendiary teddy bear explosives! Burn and destroy everything! Create alliances and destroy friendships. If you like games that are fun, this is the game for you.

Features:
Travel through Time and different Dimensions!
Overwhelmingly Fun Multiplayer Experience!
Battle Hordes of Enemies and Fantastic Challenging Bosses!
RPG Leveling and Stats!
Full Controller Support!
Procedurally generated Levels with Destructible Environments!
TONS of Creative and Unique Weaponry!
Mod and Customize your guns using a modular weapon builder to create unique weapons of destruction!
Intense Gameplay that keeps you on the edge of your seat, and keeps you coming back for more!
Loot! Get all the Gold you can!
Hidden Easter Eggs and Interactive Environments!

Source: The Publisher Website.

193523.name: The Olive Tree
193523.description:
There are many ways to promote the growth of an Olive Tree so it may endure through the centuries. Cutting branches and grafting them onto the strong rootstock is one way to ensure longevity. Another benefit is pruning back some branches in order to propagate the growth of others. Water is also very essential because the tree will require the former and latter rainfall. Even though this all has a physical application of how to maintain a healthy tree, the Bible uses this concept to express spiritual lessons.

In John 15:5 Christ says He is the vine and we are the branches... If we take that into account then the people in the Bible that followed God's commandments are "those branches" of The Olive Tree. Through the course of history Egypt, Assyria and Babylon, just to name a few, were all bent on suppressing or destroying God's people by any means possible. Will God's people make it past these tough trials?

There are many Bible games that do trivia. However, this is the first and only that focuses on learning the Bible timeline and where those people are placed in history. Have you ever wondered who Apostle Timothy followed? In what century was Moses? Where is Mordecai in the Bible? How long was Adam's lifespan? All will be answered!

The Olive Tree is a co-operative Bible timeline game that reveals God's "Spiritual Family Tree" and the "People of Faith" written about in Hebrews 11. Points are accumulated in the game by naming the correct Bible character from the Branch card and connecting it to the correct level of Root or Vine cards. The game has 9 Timeline Rounds. Will you bear enough "Fruit Points" by the end of the 9th round?

193524.name: The Olive Tree Reformation
193524.description:
In John 15:5 Christ says He is the vine and we are the branches... If we take that into account then the Protestant Reformers are also "the branches" of The Olive Tree. Towards the beginning of the 10th century most Christians lost sight of the original church's truths by means of creeping pagan compromises within their midst. In the Dark Ages the Bible and its truth was finally silenced and were instead replaced by traditions. Only a select few were allowed to read from its pages and the common people were told it would be too much for their understanding.

Then stood up reformers in the church that read the Bible and uncovered its truth. These reformers showed that the Bible was meant for one and all, thus the gospel was spread once again. However by doing these acts some of the reformers were exiled, persecuted, or even executed by the hands of the church.

For those that want a little more of a challenge, this version of The Olive Tree is for you! This game focuses on learning timelines of the Biblical characters and Protestant Reformers that brought the church back into the truth of scripture. Have you ever wondered in what century was Job? Where in the Bible does it show what Martin Luther believed? Why was Jan Hus burned at the stake? All will be answered!

The Olive Tree Reformation is a co-operative Bible timeline game that reveals God's "Spiritual Family Tree". Points are accumulated in the game by naming the correct character from the Branch card and connecting it to the correct level of Root or Vine cards. The game has 13 Timeline Rounds. Will you bear enough "Fruit Points" by the end of the 13th round?

193526.description:
Eight role cards depicting various Dice Tower Personalities (Eric Summerer, Sam Healey, Zee Garcia, Dan King, etc). During setup, each player is dealt one personality card face down. Each personality provides the player with a unique ability. Some abilities are usable once per game, whereas others may alter the win conditions for the player.

Professionally produced promo cards were made available as a Kickstarter reward for the 2015 Dice Tower fund raising campaign. The cards were also provided as a Print On Demand option for backers of the original Operation F.A.U.S.T. Kickstarter campaign.
193526.name: Operation F.A.U.S.T.: Dice Tower Personalities

193527.description:
Description from the publisher:

Prepare yourself for a horrifying journey to the frozen wastes of Antarctica! In Expedition Endurance, the fourth expansion (and fifth scenario) for T.I.M.E Stories, a temporal anomaly of the worst sort has opened up in 1914 in Antarctica. This is the year that the crew of the Endurance attempted to cross the continent and failed, and your efforts to unravel the mysteries of this temporal anomaly will carry you into a realm where temperatures drop below -40 and, as Bob warns you, there may be supernatural forces at work.
193527.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Expedition: Endurance

193528.description: This expansion has 20 new Dungeons to delve and 16 new Portals to get you there. Munchkin 6.5: Terrible Tombs is fully compatible with Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons, if you feel up to the challenge, and can also be used on its own.
193528.name: Munchkin 6.5: Terrible Tombs

193529.description:
Description from the publisher:

“I have to face him.”
–Luke Skywalker, Star Wars: Return of the Jedi

The battle for Endor has raged in three arenas—on the Forest Moon, in the skies around the Death Star, and in the Emperor’s tower, as the Lords of the Sith confront the last Jedi. Now, with the Redemption and Return Force Pack for Star Wars: The Card Game, you can play out these iconic conflicts in your own games.

Like the other Force Packs of the Endor cycle, Redemption and Return follows the climactic events of Return of the Jedi while introducing new mission cards to change your strategies and methods. These missions are objective cards that you can play under your opponent’s control, which offer powerful rewards when they’re finally destroyed. In addition to new missions, the ten new objective sets (two copies each of five distinct sets) included in this expansion offer new versions of Luke Skywalker and Emperor Palpatine to expand your options and inspire your deck-building.
193529.name: Star Wars: The Card Game – Redemption and Return

193530.name: Clown Face
193530.description:
Red leg, blue hair, yellow hand! 1, 2, 3...go!

The Chief Clown in shows three cards with different images to confuse the other clowns. After the third card is shown, all other clowns use the three cards to determine where to put their hands. The first clown placing their hand on the right combination gets all cards.

Score as many cards as you can to win Clown Face. Are you quick enough to become the new Chief Clown, or are you the clown everybody laughs at?

boardgameintegration.184565: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Bear and the Jackal

193531.description:
From the publisher:

Lock ’n Load Tactical’s Version 4.1 (v4.1) Modern era Core Rules Edition is the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Jeff Lewis, Lead Developer of the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

These rules present the core rules for the game system for modules taking place from 1960 to present. Now with all the core rules for your favorite games in one book, playing the game is easier and faster than ever.

Notable changes from previous versions of the rules (v3.1 and earlier) will be presented in BLUE text. This new edition of the rules can be used with previously published modules.

PLEASE NOTE: There is a difference between the Living Rules PDF Edition and the Printed book, the printed book does have tables and reference charts not available in the PDF. They are more of a general reference then module specific as comes in the games.

This printed book was designed with the hard core Lock ’n Load Tactical fan in mind or for those that have the older games in the series but wanted to have a hard copy set of the new rules in their hands.
193531.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Modern Era Core Rules

193532.name: Dust Tactics: Kampfgruppe Florentine
193532.description:
The famed Raketentruppe Korps of the Luftwaffe has arrived in the Middle East! Along with the rest of Operation Babylon's forces, the dreaded Raketentruppe are now fighting the Allies and the SSU in this part of the World.

Dust Studio is very proud to present this new starter with slightly revamped rules for Dust Tactics! The very beginning of a new era starts now with an amazing box full of treasures!
We're certain that it will appeal to new players and veterans alike. Whether you're new to the World of Dust or have been hanging out with us for some time now, you'll love the Luftwaffe Starter Set: Kampfgruppe Florentine.

193533.description:
This is a promotional Tile for Welcome to the Dungeon. The Toad is a 1HP creature that can be played with any set of hero equipment.

This tile is included with the IELLO Aramini Circus editions (FR or EN) of Yardmaster.
193533.name: Welcome to the Dungeon: Toad Promo

193534.name: 20.000 Leghe Sotto i Mari
193534.description:
A game inspired (as by the WD copyright notice at the end of the rules booklet) by the Walt Disney movie version of the Jules Verne famous book "20.000 Leagues Under the Sea".

From the rules (Translated from Italian):
"The goal of the Game is to take part in the fantastic voyages of the mysterious NAUTILUS submarine, and to win showing to be The Best Pilot and the Most Skilled and Intrepid Diver-Hunter of the Seas and the Surface. The Gameboard represent the Ocean: the light blue squares are the 'Medium Depths', the 'royal blue' ones the Ocean Depths. At the beginning of the game each Player receive a randomly choosen Objective card. The Players must then move across the Gameboard collecting hunting Trophies. The captured Trophies can be excanged for variable Gold Guineas amounts. At the end of the game (when the Depth Gauge in the center of the Gameboard indicate a depth of 20.000 Leagues) the Player with the most Gold Guineas win, and is declared to be 'CAPTAIN NEMO', true Master of the NAUTILUS!"

193535.name: Gaze Grabber
193535.description:
From publisher blurb:

A deceptively tiny creature, many underestimate the potency of the Gaze Grabber and its many eyes. Solitary predators by nature, gaze grabbers stalk their territories for prey to stun with their gaze, an effect that is compounded the more eyes face the same target. This capability makes them incredibly dangerous, especially to anyone who underestimates them based on their size.

193536.name: New Superpowers: Masks of Chaos
193536.description:
From publisher blurb:

Like everything else, crime has changed in the post-Ragnarok world, but it has not disappeared. Even though the most notorious costumed villains have all gone, a new generation of evildoer has filled in the void. A new syndicate called MISCHIEF has appeared. A multionational gang of thieves and killers, MISCHIEF has a unique ace up their sleeve: the Masks of Chaos.

Each Mask of Chaos grants tremendous supernatural power instantly to anyone that wears it. MISCHIEF agents uses the Masks to rob banks and assassinate crime bosses, any heist or contract that pays enough. No one knows who leads MISCHIEF or where they found the Masks they currently use. Other Masks are still hidden, buried in ancient tombs in distant corners of the Earth.

This supplement covers the history of the Masks of Chaos, MISCHIEF as a criminal organization, with stats for MISCHIEF agents, plus how to create and use the Masks in your Base Raiders game.

193537.name: Chad
193537.description: Chad is a chess variant for two players created by Christian Freeling in 1979. It is played on an uncheckered 12×12 board with one king and eight rooks per side, where rooks are able to promote to queens. Each player owns a castle consisting of 3×3 squares surrounded by a wall of 12 squares. The king may not leave his own castle and captures can only occur in certain circumstances in the castles.

193538.name: Elliot Quest
193538.description:
Elliot Quest is an adventure/RPG where players explore the mysterious Urele island in search of an ancient demon. With 5 dungeons to conquer, 16 bosses to defeat, and countless treasures to discover, Elliot Quest is inspired by Zelda II: The Adventure of Link, and many other classy titles.

Elliot can’t die—but he’s still running out of time. In Elliot Quest, the victim of a rare curse must find a cure before he’s transformed into a demon.

Source: The Game Website.

193539.name: Death of Legends: First Kingdoms
193539.description:
From publisher blurb:

First Kingdoms is an expansion for the Death of Legends dark-fantasy roleplaying game. Take the fight against the Enemy to the frozen, magic-infused, First Kingdoms.

Nobody knows what fate befell the Ancients. One day they were simply gone; only their magic remained.The City of Winterfall

For centuries there was peace amongst the elder races. But soon diplomacy and trade gave way to greed and conflict as Frost Elves warred with Stone Dwarves. Ice Dragons and Tree Folk attacked any who dared enter their territory.

The long summer of the Ancients had given way to perpetual winter when the young races arrived in the First Kingdoms.

From the freezing sea the Water-Sworn came in longships, raiding and plundering with fierce hunger. From the East a new power rose as a hundred different tribes and peoples banded together for mutual protection and prosperity, forming a mighty Royal Coalition.

These new arrivals were not welcomed by the elder races who still guarded their secrets jealously. War raged for years, a legacy of blood and suffering built on ever-changing alliances and treaties, as each faction sought dominance.

Finally, exhausted by war, an uneasy peace descended on the First Kingdoms.

But now a dark power has risen. It commands monstrous armies and seeks dominion over the First Kingdoms.

War is coming and nobody knows who can be trusted.

This expansion presents a new, highly magical, land where a shared history of war and conflict has fostered an atmosphere of suspicion and distrust between elder and younger races alike. Legendary heroes representing each race must decide who among them can be trusted in the battle for the survival against a powerful and malevolent Enemy who seeks dominion over the First Kingdoms.

First Kingdoms includes

Six new character archetypes including; Ice Dragon, Tree Folk, Frost Elf, Stone Dwarf, Water-Sworn (human) and Royal Coalition (human).
A map of the First Kingdoms with 18 territories specific to the characters and one non-aligned territory (Ruins of the Ancients).
Five new Final Act cards reflecting special actions or powers that manifest when a Legend dies (and a copy of the 'In League with the Enemy' card from the original game).
A brief guide to the First Kingdoms and notes to support facilitation of the game

193540.name: Ghostknight
193540.description:
From publisher blurb:

A genetically perfect specimen, augmented by the Astral Forge, and a former Knightstar, Wal-Las is an invisible enemy of evil. Exacting justice throughout the galaxy, this "Ghostknight" (PL 10) strikes without warning, casting fear into those who seek to break galactic law.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

193541.name: Warp Speed Warriors
193541.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jump to Warp Speed!

Between the dominion of the militaristic Khor and the shapeshifting Faez empire sits Freespace, and unclaimed stretch of inhabited stars threatened by the god-like Inphinites, the transforming Machina, and the vampiric Manes. In recent years, the most notorious champions of Freespace have been an unlikely assortment of heroes: a trigger-happy genetically-augmented mammalian; an enigmatic Arborhulk; the galaxy’s most deadly assassin; a vengeful soldier with nothing to lose; and a scoundrel from the savage world of Earth. They are the best chance Freespace has of remaining free.

God help us all.

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

193542.name: 7th Sea Quickstart
193542.description:
From Introduction:

This is the rules packet for the 7th Sea quickstart adventure “Niech Żyje Książę!” (or “Long Live the Prince!”).

Here you will find an overview of the rules as a whole—how to roll dice and count Raises, what Skills cover, and some suggested expanded uses for those Skills.

Most of the rules that you need for specific parts of the adventure are included here.

193543.name: Blaze Monster Dome Challenge Game
193543.description:
Blaze down the Monster Dome Track to win the race! Monster Dome Challenge introduces preschoolers to concepts such as magnetism, trajectory, force, acceleration and more! Blaze and the Monster Machines is a new and exciting CG interactive series for preschoolers featuring Blaze, the world's most amazing monster truck, his driver, an eight-year-old boy named AJ, and their adventures in Axle City — a town populated with big-wheeled vehicles known as Monster Machines.

Blaze Monster Dome Challenge Game:

Age Range: 3 years and up
Build social and coordination skills
Help Blaze and his friends take the Monster Dome Challenge
Kids will learn about science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) concepts
Use memory skills to overcome obstacles Crusher has put in the path




Game Play Overview:

Choose a monster truck character.
Spin and move a character that many spaces.
When ending on a space:
Blue opstacle space - Choose one of the tokens and flip it over. If it symbol matches the icon on the space, then that character keeps the token and the turn ends. If it the symbol on the token doesn't match, return it to the stack and the turn ends.
Crusher Cheats - Go back one space.
Give Me Speed - Go forward one space.

Take turns in order until one monster truck crosses the finish line.
All monster trucks count up their tokens on the one with the most is the winner.

193544.name: Blaze and the Monster Machines Axle City Adventure Game
193544.description:
Work together with the other Monster Machines to get to the big race! Kids enjoy playing their favorite characters from the popular Nickelodeon series. Challenges cover over 40 simple STEM concepts (science, technology, engineering, and math).

Blaze and the Monster Machines Axle City Adventure Game:

Blaze and the Monster Machines is a new, exciting, and interactive Nickelodeon series for preschoolers
In the Axle City Adventure, players travel through Axle City and solve STEM challenges (science, technology, engineering and math)
Kids work together to save a friend or thwart Crusher's mischief in this speedy, cooperative board game
Challenges cover over 40 simple STEM concepts
Contents include: 2-sided game board, 5 monster machines and stands, 36 axle city adventure cards, 1 six-colored die, instructions




Game Play Overview:
Players work together to get all monster machines to the big race. All monster machines start on the start space of its matching colored track. Players take turns in order:

Roll the die and move the matching color monster machine 1 space; black is wild (choose any monster machine) If the monster machine ends on a traffic light space, draw an adventure card, read the question and select an answer. If correct, move ahead one more spot. If wrong, turn is over.
The game ends when all monster machines reach the finish line. When rolling the die, if the color of a machine that already finished comes up, select another monster machine.

193545.name: Frostbite
193545.description:
"The freezing wind rips at the strappings of our hut. I feel it bite at my knuckles, slicing the flesh open. Our time here is short. The wildlife has all moved on and we must follow. We are leaving everything we know behind in search of warmth before it is too late. Even the sun does not show her face here anymore. The revenge of winter is upon us. I fear some may not make it out alive..."

In Frostbite, players collect resources and assemble huts, but must be wary of the bitter cold while doing so. The weather changes constantly and the temperature keeps falling. Players must endure until the final shelters are created!

Each player has five action points per round to use for migrating, scouting, hunting, gathering wood, crafting shelter, and raiding other clans. Players migrate by moving their clan member tokens. They may gather wood only in forest regions and may hunt only in regions with wildlife. Hunting success is determined by die roll. When failing to kill wildlife, a card is drawn to determine the direction it runs away, possibly into another clan's territory. Once players have enough resources, they may build or upgrade shelters.

After each round, cards are drawn to decrease the temperature in different areas. Clan members die if they occupy a region that is too cold, but this may be mitigated by fur coats and shelters.

Only the clans that complete their villages will survive and claim victory.

193546.name: SAVAGE FRONTIER: Game of Adventure and Survival in Colonial America.
193546.description:
INTRODUCTION
The year is 1754 and tensions are increasing between France and Britain. In far off America, citizens of both sides are concerned only with their basic survival and prosperity. Commerce and trading are bountiful, even, with the Indians. In the Frontier regions, hunters and trappers are gathering a variety of furs and pelts to sell and trade with the many Indian tribes, as well as, Europeans. As the clouds of war are brewing, brave heroes of the frontier will find themselves caught between making a living and serving their Countries; some will even become legends.

OBJECTIVE
SAVAGE FRONTIER is a game for 1-4 Players. Each Player creates a Player Hero starting out in what will, hopefully be, a long and prosperous life in North American Colonies. During play, Player Heroes (Heroes) will conduct a variety of tasks such as hunting, trapping and trading. In the meantime, however, a war between France and Britain is going on and Heroes may find themselves pressed into Military service as Scouts or Militia for their Sovereign Countries. The surviving Hero with the most Legend Points at the end of the last turn is the Winner.

PLAY MECHANICS
Players move their Hero Counters on a hex map representing a fictitious area along the New York and Canadian Border in order to complete a variety of assignments. Some special assignments are determined by drawing Assignment Cards. Assignment Challenges and Combat are resolved using Dice. Battles involving larger forces take place on a Battle Mat.

193547.name: Soulknives
193547.description:
From publisher blurb:

Augment your soulknife with these new blade skills and archetypes for the iconic blade wielder from Ultimate Psionics!

Contained in the pages of Psionics Augmented: Soulknives are dozens of new blade skills such as Blade Rush and Cleave Space, as well as three new soulknife archetypes.

These new archetypes include the augmented blade, who forms a psicrystal to aid him in combat, the brutality blade who channels rage into his weapon, and the psychic armor, who forms a panoply of blades around her body.

Whether hurling mind blades at distant enemies or rushing in for the strike, soulknives of all forms will find something useful in this latest release in our Psionics Augmented line!

193548.name: Mythic Psionics
193548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let’s get Mythic!

Although psionic characters and creatures can alter the very nature of reality, some have achieved a level of power that goes beyond even the extraordinary and into the realm of mythic. With Psionics Augmented: Mythic Psionics, you will find character options to allow psionic characters to play in mythic games, using the same rules as their non-psionic counterparts. But mythic characters need mythic enemies, and you will also find a variety of mythic psionic monsters to challenge your players in new and unique ways!

Psionics Augmented: Mythic Psionics is over 70 pages of new content and contains:

A new mythic path, the overmind, aimed at manifesters




Psionic path abilities for the other mythic paths

Mythic versions of feats such as Deep Focus, allowing a character to always be treated as maintaining focus, or Psicrystal Affinity, where even your psicrystal is mythic
Three hundred mythic versions of psionic powers, taking powers to whole new levels like a Mythic Energy Ball that freezes creatures in place or sets them on fire
Nine mythic psionic monsters, including the classics like the gray glutton and phrenic scourge, but also newer monsters like the deranged trepanner and ghaar
And more!




Unlock the secrets of mythic psionics!

193549.name: Valentine Special - Red Fury
193549.description:
From publisher blurb:

Red Fury is wise-cracking mercenary with heart of gold. And buns of steel. He will always do what's right. Or what pays. Or both. But probably what's right.

And he's available right now to liven up your ICONS game. Provide your own chimichangas.

193550.name: Magika: Escuelas en Guerra
193550.description:
The magic kingdom lives in peace. The world is safe thanks to their knowledge and wisdom, but their youngs, so full of life, needs excitement and competition to fulfill their youthful desires.

So they gather to practice Magika, a magic meele between schools to see who is the one who is wise enough to choose allies and defeat their oponents with his magic powers.

Each player has 5 treasures to protect, and 5 to collect. Each turn you can decide to gather more hex cards from the deck, or attack another player. To do so, your reveal an hex, and ask friend to support you by giving a card to add to the attack, so they must choose wisely what to do next. But if hexes matches, you can make alliances with the defender and betray your supporters. The first to have the 5 treasures win... but it won't be easy.

Magika is a fast game with a mixture of set collection and alliances, in a fast paced game full of fun.

boardgamehonor.41718: 2017 Premio Alfonso X Mejor Juego Nominee

193551.description:
In a near future, agrotoxics and contamination created some strange mutant plants... who are really scary! But hey, profit is profit, so you have to be the best farmer and make them grow.

You have 12 actions in the table (half face down, half face up) that allows you to gather resources (tokens), get plants, and nurture them. Each turn you have 2/3 actions, and what you use and what you block stop your friends to do the same. You need to take care of your resources, and you don't know exactly what action is available next, so your plans can be hard to reach. You have to get your crops well nurtured to score, and they do crazy stuff together, so keep and eye in other players crops, to be sure you have the best mutants to score points and win the game.

Cultivos Mutantes is a fast and light resource manager, a perfect introductory game to euros mechanics who plays in half an hour.
193551.name: Mutant Crops

193552.name: Crimson Cutlass Book One: Fundamentals
193552.description:
From publisher blurb:

Role-playing rules for adventures set in the Era of Exploration and Reformation. Original was published in 1979, second edition followed in 1989; here is the 2015 edit with new materials including extra dueling methods.

193553.name: Crimson Cutlass Book Two: Designing Scenarios
193553.description:
From publisher blurb:

Role-playing rules for adventures set in the Era of Exploration and Reformation. Original was published in 1979, second edition followed in 1989; here is the 2015 edit with new materials including enhanced climax challenges.

193554.name: Crimson Cutlass Book Three: Encounters
193554.description:
From publisher blurb:

Role-playing rules for adventures set in the Era of Exploration and Reformation. Original was published in 1979, second edition followed in 1989; here is the 2015 edit with new materials including additional settings of adventure.

193555.name: Blocksmiths
193555.description:
Blocksmithing is a noble art. Not just anybody can collect a raw block of wood or iron and, through much careful crafting (and a big hammer) create weapons fit for heroes, lordlings, and rangers of the wild.

Players will take on the roles of blocksmiths, competing to run the best blocksmith shop in town. Using a spin down die worker placement mechanic (no rolling of dice!), players are rewarded for careful planning. Hire additional workers to help around the shop. Manage your resources, as well as, your hand of action cards. Fulfill orders for customers and convert them to repeat buyers.

Blocksmiths is a euro game for 2-4 players, playable in 45-60 min.

193556.name: REBUKE: My People
193556.description:
OVERVIEW:
While playing the original REBUKE, do you often times enjoy when a Talk About It card is discussed? Well, have I got some good news for you. This deck is filled to the brim with nothing but Talk About It cards. You have 2 options. Do you shuffle a few of these cards into the original REBUKE game to create a new experience or do you treat this expansion as its own game and solely play and discuss Talk About It cards as a group? Enjoy the game either way you choose.

EXPANSION FOR THE ORIGINAL REBUKE:
The My People expansion can be used in conjunction with the original REBUKE. In order to play a game with this expansion first locate the 12 Talk About It cards in the original REBUKE. Remove these Talk About It cards from the Deck and replace them with 12 Talk About It cards from this expansion. Or you can mix and match these cards together as long as there is 12 in the game.

All expansion cards are identified by an "E:2" at the top right hand corner. This shows the difference between the cards of the expansion and cards of the game. Now you are all set to play REBUKE. Follow the original REBUKE Rules because they are still played the same way.

REBUKE: MY People GAMEPLAY:
When treating REBUKE: My People as a stand-alone game, the amount of maximum players can be 7. Shuffle all the cards together and place them in the middle of the playing field. This will be the Deck. Pick a player, that player will be the Drawer for the rest of the game.

Turns consists of the Drawer drawing the top card of the Deck and reading aloud the card topic. The Drawer will voice his/her opinion of the topic first. Once he/she has finished speaking that player will pass the card to the player on the right. The player on the right will now be able to voice their opinion of the topic and like-wise pass the card down in the same manner. This continues until all players have had a chance to speak. Once all players have spoken, then the Talk About It card is placed into the Discard Pile. The Discard Pile is located next to the Draw stack. That turn is now over and a new turn begins with the Drawer drawing from the Deck.

In this version of the game there is no winners or losers its purely about discussion. Make sure not to interrupt while a player is speaking. The game ends once all the cards have been discussed. The Talk About It cards can be pulled from both the original REBUKE and the Heavy Burdens expansion to add even more topics to My People gameplay.

193557.description:
Description from the publisher:

Run fast, score big! Android: Mainframe is a fast-paced strategy game set in the not-too-distant future of the Android universe!

In the game, you and up to three opponents are elite cybercriminals known as runners who are competing for control of a vulnerable bank's various accounts. At the beginning of the game, you mark your arrival by the placement of your first access point. Then, each turn, you get to take a single action: establish another access point, execute a program, or pass. Your goal is to use the programs at your disposal to secure your access points so that they control as many of Titan's vulnerable accounts as possible.

Most of the generic programs write pathways between Titan's various nodes, allowing you to place a blue partition between the nodes on the board. Whenever your partitions seal off a section of the board containing only your access point or access points, they are "secured" and flipped face down. They are no longer vulnerable to your opponents' programs, and you will score the accounts they control at the end of the game.

Android: Mainframe differs from its predecessor Bauhaus in a number of ways, such as each player having a hand of cards and the game including six runners who each have five distinctive programs.
193557.name: Android: Mainframe

boardgamehonor.40555: 2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee

193558.description:
Description from the publisher:

"For once, Zeus, Greek god of thunder and sky, is in high spirits. Hence, he decides to offer a generous gift to a worthy mortal and invite him, or her, to his realm, to Olympus. To determine a sufficient candidate, Zeus hosts a competition for his entertainment. Twelve legendary tasks are imposed upon the fearless participants: to erect graceful statues, to raise awe-inspiring sanctuaries, to offer capacious offerings, and to slay the most fearsome monsters. The first participant to master all the posed assignments wins the favor of the father of the gods himself.

Indubitably, you will not pass up this golden opportunity, so you clear your ship and rally your crew to follow on the trails of legendary Odysseus through the dangerous waters of the Aegean. But how could you find the righteous path onward? There is but one who can help you. Visit the mysterious oracle of Delphi and let her answers guide your ways.

In Stefan Feld's new game The Oracle of Delphi, the player's ships travel across a large variable game board of hexagonal tiles showing islands and the surrounding waters. Each player aims to reach certain islands to perform the twelve tasks given by Zeus: e.g., to collect offerings of different colors and to deliver them to corresponding temples, or to slay monsters of a specific type (and color), all of which can be discovered on the islands.

In order to execute these color-dependent actions, you are given three colored dice each turn, the so-called "oracle dice". Rolling the dice (at the start of the turn) is equivalent to consulting the oracle, whereas the results represent her answers. The answers determine which actions you will be able to take, but you will always have three actions per turn. However, a slight divergence from your fate is often possible.

In addition to the oracle, you can request support from the gods and you can acquire favor tokens, companions, and other special abilities that will help you win the race against other competitors.

Differently equipped ships and the variable set-up of the game board will offer new challenging and interesting strategic and tactical decisions with every new game of The Oracle of Delphi that you play.
193558.name: The Oracle of Delphi

193559.name: Half Dead
193559.description:
User Summary

Half dead is a multiplayer sci-fi game about a violent TV show. Players' goal is to survive in a network of rooms full of traps.

193560.description:
What are “Escape the Room” games?

Escape the Room games began as digital adventures and quickly turned into real-life events all around the world where players are locked in a room and must uncover clues and hidden objects to escape. ThinkFun’s version of Escape the Room allows you to bring all the excitement of these experiences into your very own home!

The Mystery:
It’s 1869 and the town’s well-respected astronomer has not been seen since the untimely passing of his wife. Recently, strange things have been happening at his manor – loud and unfamiliar noises, an unpleasant smell, and smoke billowing from the observatory. It’s up to you and your guests to solve the mystery at the Stargazer’s Manor!

The Objective:
Spend an evening working with your guests to solve puzzles, unlock hidden clues, and unravel the mystery of the Stargazer’s Manor. Will you and your guests be able to solve the mystery and save the astronomer before time runs out?
193560.name: Escape the Room: Mystery at the Stargazer's Manor

193569.name: Eldritch
193569.description:
Eldritch is a game set in H.P. Lovecraft’s gothic world of unfathomable creatures and ancient powers. From 3 to 5 players, you play cultists vying for the favour of the Great Old Ones who slumber away the ages in their mythical prisons across the cosmos.

Travel to strange locations in search of fragments of spells and glyphs of power; uncover ancient mysteries, defeat challenges, and risk your very sanity to be the first player to conjure the manifestation of your favoured deity.

Cast spells, send twisted beasts to assault your foes, and build your own power base – using your own sanity to fuel your efforts. Risk too much and you will go irrevocably insane…

With art by the amazing Will Liu, Eldritch features a slew of cards, dice, madness counters, and… four giant and gorgeous models of the Great Old Ones: Hastur, Nodens, Cthulhu, and Ithaqua which are your ultimate goal and the means by which you will crush your enemies!

Coming in 2016

193570.name: Braveland Pirate
193570.description:
The Braveland trilogy concludes with the most exciting book of all, number three – welcome to Braveland Pirate strategy game! A crew of pirates led by Captain Jim embarks on a search for the Eternal Treasure. Hordes of undead, chests full of gold, devious pirate captains, and breathtaking adventures await you in the Free Islands.

Source: The Developer Website.

193571.name: Bestiarium Hispaniae
193571.description:
From the publisher site:

Toda leyenda tiene un origen. Los hechos se cuentan, se transmiten de boca en boca llenando de matices lo ocurrido con cada nueva interpretación. Las supersticiones añaden nuevos datos que avivan las historias hasta hacerlas reales. Bestias ocultas, pueblos malditos, dragones, espectros… Las leyendas cobran vida en este compendio de seres míticos y fantásticos.

Bestiarium Hispaniae es un completo suplemento para Aquelarre en el que Ricard Ibáñez nos detalla criaturas míticas de la España medieval. Manteniendo la estética de la nueva edición de Aquelarre y replicando los bestiarios medievales clásicos, Bestiarium Hispaniae es un elemento imprescindible para tus partidas. En su páginas podrás incluir:

284 páginas repletas de ánimas, espectros, seres feéricos, animales fantásticos, sierpes, dragones y otras criaturas como los licántropos y los ogros.
Más de 120 criaturas completamente ilustradas.
Todos los valores de juego para poder utilizarlas en tus partidas.
Ideas de aventura para cada uno de los seres presentados y leyendas relacionadas con las criaturas.
Nuevos Orgullos y Vergüenzas para jugar personajes no jugadores con habilidades y poderes fruto de ser descendientes de criaturas irracionales.
Una aventura final ambientada en la noche más mágica del año: la noche de San Juan, cuando las puertas a lo mágico se abren para dejar pasar las leyendas.





Translation courtesy of Google:

Every legend has a source. The facts are counted, transmitted from mouth filled with nuances what happened with each new interpretation. Superstitions add new data that fuel the stories to make them real. hidden beasts, cursed people, dragons, ghosts ... The legends come to life in this collection of mythical and fantastic creatures.

Bestiarium Hispaniae is a complete supplement for Coven in which we detailed Ricard Ibáñez mythical creatures of medieval Spain. Maintaining the aesthetics of the new edition of Coven and replicating the classic medieval bestiary, Bestiarium Hispaniae is an essential element to your games. In its pages you can include:

284 pages full of spirits, ghosts, fey creatures, fantastic animals, snakes, dragons and other creatures such as werewolves and ogres.
Over 120 fully illustrated creatures.
All set values ​​to use in your games.
Ideas adventure for each of the presented and legends about creatures beings.
New Prides and embarrassment to play NPCs with abilities and powers fruit of descent from irrational creatures.
A final adventure set in the most magical night of the year: the night of San Juan, when the doors to the magical open to let the legends.

193573.name: Prepar3D v1
193573.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X.




User Summary

Prepar3D is Lockheed Martin's continuation of the Microsoft Flight Simulator family of games. It is based on the Microsoft ESP simulator, which is the commercial-user version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X. While Prepar3D is fully licensed and authorized by Microsoft, the limitations of that license prevent it being sold for "personal computer entertainment". It is however seen by many members of the flight sim community as the natural continuation of the series, and the licensing constraints that it is sold under are not seen as a limitation to the end user.

193574.name: Prepar3D v2
193574.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X.




User Summary

Prepar3D is Lockheed Martin's continuation of the Microsoft Flight Simulator family of games. It is based on the Microsoft ESP simulator, which is the commercial-user version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X. While Prepar3D is fully licensed and authorized by Microsoft, the limitations of that license prevent it being sold for "personal computer entertainment". It is however seen by many members of the flight sim community as the natural continuation of the series, and the licensing constraints that it is sold under are not seen as a limitation to the end user.

v2 introduced a substantial number of changes to the underlying code of the software. This includes multi-core CPU support, and most notably the transition from DirectX 9 to DirectX 11.

v2 also includes additional aircraft created by third party developers:


F-22 (IRIS Flight Simulation Software)
F-35A (India India Alpha Foxtrot Echo)
Bonanza A-36 (Carenado)
Extra 300s (Alabeo)


While retaining the same name as its predecessor, it is sold as a separate product, much like an annual edition of a sports video game franchise.

193575.name: Prepar3D v3
193575.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X.




User Summary

Prepar3D is Lockheed Martin's continuation of the Microsoft Flight Simulator family of games. It is based on the Microsoft ESP simulator, which is the commercial-user version of Microsoft Flight Simulator X. While Prepar3D is fully licensed and authorized by Microsoft, the limitations of that license prevent it being sold for "personal computer entertainment". It is however seen by many members of the flight sim community as the natural continuation of the series, and the licensing constraints that it is sold under are not seen as a limitation to the end user.

While superficially v3 is not as big an update as v2, it does incorporate a number of new technologies including Autodesk Scaleform and SpeedTree. It also introduced native support for an Avatar Mode, allowing users to exit their vehicles and navigate the environment using a human model in first- or third-person modes.

v3 also includes additional aircraft created by third party developers:


H-60 Black Hawk (Virtavia)
F-35A [new version] (India India Alpha Foxtrot Echo)


While retaining the same name as its predecessors, it is sold as a separate product, much like an annual edition of a sports video game franchise.

193576.description:
Dark Future was an expansion set sold as boosters for the Shadowfist game. The story takes place in the future juncture of the Secret War. The Reascended are introduced: the Ascended reborn using High Tech. Also, a new faction debuts: The Purists are masters of magic, math and paradox.

From the booster box:
The Architects' iron rule weakens as they fight a civil war masterminded by Homo Omega, who uses the distraction to plot humanity's destruction. It all comes to a head in the year 2062, as heroes die, a new faction is born, and the world spirals closer to a Dark future.
193576.name: Shadowfist: Dark Future

193577.description:
In the year 3250, the Galactic Empire is at peace. Mankind’s heroes are not warriors — they’re the daring Traders who journey between the stars. With your trusty hyperdrive ship, you are a Star Trader. You will build trading stations on alien worlds, and race other Traders to be the first to deliver cargoes from world to world. Your goal: to acquire great wealth — and please the almighty Emperor — until you can earn the title of STAR TSAR!

Brought to you by original creator David Ladyman, Star Traders has been redesigned and upgraded since its release by Steve Jackson Games in 1987. In it you are a heroic starship captain navigating the galaxy's trade lanes in search of fortune and glory. You must make deals, deliver cargoes and traverse risky jumps, all while competing against your fellow captains in a SciFi themed universe filled with iconic tropes.
193577.name: Star Traders

193578.name: Super Nudge 2000

videogameversion.300617: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition

193578.description:
From the inlay:

SUPER NUDGE 2000 is a superb simulator of a modern fruit machine incorporating many of the features found on them. You are given £1.00 to play with. Good luck and don't break the bank too much!

User Summary

In-game the fruit machine is called Fruitbank in the Commodore 64 and Amstrad versions, as opposed to Super Nudge 2000 on the inlay and cassette. The Spectrum version is called Super Nudge in-game.

The layouts are slightly different between the three versions, but include the same functions as a classic fruit machine - holds, nudges, a gamble track (stop the flashing lights to advance to a higher value payout) and a Feature track. The C64 and Amstrad versions are three-reel machines while the Spectrum version is a five-reel machine.

193579.name: Microsoft Flight Simulator: Steam Edition

videogamecompilation.82184: Flight Simulator X Acceleration Expansion Pack

193579.description:
User Summary

Microsoft Flight Simulator X: Steam Edition is the re-release of the original Microsoft Flight Simulator X and all of its service packs as well as the Acceleration expansion pack.

This new version incorporates Steam services to enable multiplayer support, replacing the defunct and no longer operating GameSpy services of past editions, as well as updates to improve compatibility and performance on more recent versions of Windows. It also supports DLC that is published exclusively (or sometimes timed exclusives) via Steam.

It is updated and published by Dovetail Games under license from Microsoft.

193581.name: Sailor Moon
193581.description:
The players race along the board rolling their dices, stumbling occasionally in special "character squares" with positive or negative effects to their advance. The first to reach the last square (Queen Peryl) wins the game.

Little more than a thematic game of the goose, capitalizing cheaply on the popular franchise rights.

193582.name: Duskwall Heist Deck
193582.description:
From the back of the box:

"Blades in the Dark" lets you play scoundrels pulling heists in the haunted city of Duskwall. This Heist Deck provides colorful employers, targets, treasures, and obstacles.

Spice up your highly improvisational game with some new ideas grounded in the setting and ready for your use!

193583.name: Sonic Boom: Shattered Crystal
193583.description:
Back of box

It Takes A Team

Eager to get his claws on the forgotten Lost Crystal of Power, the evil Lyric kidnaps Amy to help him locate the shards. Sonic, Tails Knuckles and new friend Sticks work as a team to save her and locate the Crystal before it is too late.

193584.name: The Last Garden
193584.description:
The world as we know it has ended. One woman is all that remains of the human race, and she is known only by her title: The Queen. As her final decree, The Queen aims to recreate the beautiful and lush gardens of her youth. However, there is very little moisture left, so The Queen will implement a new plan.

In her travels, The Queen has accumulated a collection of out-of-commission mining robots. She has reprogrammed them all into Robotanists and will use them to turn metal and rare gems into an elaborate garden. The Robotanist AI isn't the best, but they'll try as hard as they can to please their Queen. She doesn't quite remember exactly what the gardens look like, but she'll know it when she sees it. Until then, the Robotanists will work the mines, build the garden, and place gems as they all vie to be the Queen's favorite.

The Last Garden is a worker placement and betting game for 2-4 players. Each player controls a number of Robotanists as they seek to create a beautiful garden out of scraps and gems. On every turn, a player places a Robotanist onto the board and plays a card that shifts the structures in the garden or manipulates gems. At the end of a set number of days, the player who has gained the most favor wins.

193585.description: Player Board created by Stefan Feld exclusively for the regional qualifying round of the German board game championship 2016.
193585.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 7th Expansion – German Board Game Championship Board 2016

193586.name: Blastball GO
193586.description:
User Summary

Blastball GO is a puzzle game designed by Kris Burm, the designer of the the popular GIPF Project. In the game, the player must place orange and purple balls onto a grid of shifting tiles. The colors are placed in alternating order and then a tile is shifted. The player is trying to create rows of at least 5 balls. When creating a row, the player will get special power balls that allow balls to change colors or tiles to rotate.

This is a the simplest of the games in the Blastball franchise and is limited to 15 turns per game.

193587.name: Blastball MAX
193587.description:
User Summary

Blastball MAX is a puzzle game designed by Kris Burm, the designer of the the popular GIPF Project. In the game, the player must place orange and purple balls onto a grid of shifting tiles. The colors are placed in alternating order and then a tile is shifted. The player is trying to create rows of at least 5 balls. When creating a row, the player will get special power balls that allow balls to change colors, tiles to rotate, and many other special boosts.

Blastball MAX contains levels, missions, and other extensions to the basic gameplay. Each game is 25 turns.

193588.name: The Rainbow 18

boardgameintegration.184011: Duelo Primigenio: The Rainbow Shoushiling Cards Project

193588.description:
Game played with the Duelo Primigenio Deck

In this game , 18 cards of the Duelo Primigenio Deck are used . Numbers are not used in the mechanics.

Three cards are placed face down in a row , the colors of the one that is in the right has the most power , the left the least.

Players will receive 5 cards each . Reverses of the cards should be shown to every player.

Each player will guess how many tricks will win ( they will be five)

The rules to play the trick are , each player play a card and they must follow the suit played by the first player in that trick . The player that wins the trick is the one with the suit with the color with more power .

Winning the tricks is not the goal, the goal is to guess correctly how many you will win . If you not guess correctly you will not receive the victory points .

A player will win when his victory points arrive to 18.

193589.description:
The game covers the battle of Berlin in 1945, the last great battle of World War II.

Can be connected with Czerwony Huragan (Budziszyn 1945).
193589.name: Berlin 1945

boardgamecompilation.184011: Duelo Primigenio: The Rainbow Shoushiling Cards Project

193590.description:
Game for children where creativity and memory are mixed.

The children will have to use the cards to build a collage. They will receive them to "paint" their artwork as prize if they find the couple of the card .

A rainbow is built with the cards face down .
Then the adult will ask to find some specific couple of suit . Example : Find a Red Rock and a Green Rock . If they are found the cards are taken as prize to be placed to form a picture(collage) previously seen.

The goal is to have fun finding the couples and "painting" the collage of cards.

A very simple game to stimulate memory and creativity
193590.name: Have you ever Paint with...Cards!

193592.name: Gas Out
193592.description: Place Guster the Gas Cloud on the center of the table and then deal 3 Gas Out cards to each player. If you play a Number card, press Guster as many times as the number shown-but watch out! Guster's blasts are not silent and they're definitely deadly. If Guster farts, you're out! Other Gas Out cards in the deck keep the fun tooting along like the Skip card which sends Guster onto the next player, or the Reverse card that "blows" him back in the opposite direction. Be the last player to keep Guster the Gas Cloud from farting during your turn, and you win!

193593.name: Voobrazhariy: Junior
193593.description:
From the publisher (translated):
Explain what is plasticine or a popsicle, show other players autopilot or a gate, draw sneezing or an underachiever — any of that in just in 1 minute! You just have to be understood.
"Voobrazhariy" — is a fun game for a cheerful company and is based on guessing words. The Junior edition is designed for young players and contains the tasks that are understandable and accessible to children.

From the publisher (Russian):
Объясни, что такое пластилин и эскимо, изобрази гололёд и салочки, нарисуй чихание или двоечника — всего за 1 минуту. Главное, чтобы тебя поняли!
«Воображарий» — увлекательная игра на загадывание и разгадывание слов для весёлой компании. Издание Junior рассчитано на самых юных игроков и содержит задания, понятные и доступные детям.

193596.name: Huuuuu
193596.description:
From the game box:

Huuuuu, they jump, they stack, they run... Who will be the first with his team of ghosts in the center of the castle and win the game.

User description:

In this roll-and-move game, players control 4 ghosts which need to get to the centre of the board by exact count.

Players start with 1 ghost. Once a ghost crosses the “2”, “3” or “4” space, the player may enter in play his second, third and fourth ghost.

If a player’s ghost reaches a space occupied by another one of his ghosts, he stacks the ghosts and can then move them together as one.

If a ghost reaches a space of his color that is occupied by an opponent’s ghost, he sends the opponent’s ghost back to the beginning. If a ghost occupies a space of its color, it blocks the opponents’ ghosts, who then need to roll a 6 to get by.

Colored spaces are numbered 1 through 5 in ascending order. If a ghost reaches a space of his color, the player can choose to roll a die and move forward or back to the matching space (on a 6, the ghost goes back to the beginning).

Every time a ghost reaches the centre, it is placed on a scoring track (first place gets 16 points, second place gets 15 points and so on). When all of the ghosts have reached the centre, the points for each color are added up and the highest total wins.

193599.name: Mississippi Steel
193599.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have four Attributes (Control/Temper, Reaction Time/Agility, Steering/Intelligence, and Style/Charisma). Characters are associated with a Pit Crew, also with four Attributes (Knowledge/Crew Chief, Hand-to-Eye/Tire Changers, Speed/Go-Getter, and Coordination/The Rest of the Pit Crew). Characters have a Car, also with four Attributes (Speed, Brakes, Handling, and Acceleration). All of these Attributes have associated numeric values assigned from points pools.

Characters in the game are all race car drivers and the campaign focuses on outfitting automobiles, performing repairs, and - primarily - racing against other characters and non-player characters.

193600.name: Microlite74 Swords & Sorcery Edition, Version 1.0
193600.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Swords & Sorcery is designed for low level play in swords & sorcery settings. If the fantasy stories of Robert E. Howard, Fritz Lieber, Clark Ashton Smith, C.L. Moore, Karl Edward Wagner, and David Gemell are more to your taste that those of Tolkein or Eddings, this version of Microlite74' may be just what you are looking for. Microlite74 Swords & Sorcery is based on Microlite74 Extended 3.0 but with many special rules designed for swords & sorcery style campaigns. For example, there are only two classes (Adventurer and Sorcerer) and 6 levels, magic is limited and casting certain spells can corrupt the caster, and many 0e style magic items are relics of dead civilizations from long ago. Humans are assumed to dominate the world and most enemies are other humans and animals. True monsters certainly exist but they are assumed to be rare. Unlike most Microlite74 games which use a Microlite20-based experience system, this version uses a more standard experience point system.

193601.name: Crime Time
193601.description:
User Summary

Crime Time is a text adventure by Sebastian Broghammer, released by Starbyte Software. The game uses a joystick interface, where the player can chose directions, items and actions. The story is about a murder, and needs to prove the player is innocent.

193602.name: Microlite78 First Edition Lite
193602.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite78 First Edition Lite is a trimmed-down miniature version of the Primary Fantasy SRD rules designed to be quick and easy to play, especially when compared to modern incarnations of the game. The goal of Microlite78 First Edition Lite is do for First Edition (1e) what Microlite74 did for the Original Edition (0e): to recreate the style and feel of the First Edition of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game published back in 1978 without giving up all of the clearer mechanics of modern D20-based versions.

The Microlite78 First Edition Lite rules are based on the Microlite74 Extended rules modified as necessary to fit the 1978 First Edition (1e) of the world’s most popular fantasy roleplaying game. Modifications include detailed first edition class descriptions with a standard old school experience system (instead of one based on Microlite20); complete monsters, spell, and treasure descriptions; rules for strongholds, magic reasearch, optional psionics, and more. These rules are not intended to be a clone of the first edition rules, but rather a conversion of them to a rules-lite D20-based system that encourages old school play without strictly old-school rules. Although Microlite78 First Edition Lite is a complete game, it assumes a basic knowledge on the part of the GM of how roleplaying games and the basic D20-system work. At about 160 pages, the rules are lean and do not hold your hand.

Microlite78 First Edition Lite can easily be used with all original first edition adventures and settings (as well as those for BECMI or second edition with a bit of work) as well as with modern OSR adventures and settings.

rpgitemversion.300654: Light vs Dark Version 3.0 (Condensed Type Edition) PDF

193603.name: Microlite74 Light vs Dark
193603.description:
From publisher blurb:

Microlite74 Light vs Dark (formerly titled Microlite74 Special Version I) is designed for a campaign world with only two deities (a Lord of Light (order) and a Lord of Darkness (chaos) who oppose each other. Magic is both common and rare in this campaign world in that about 25% of the population have the ability to use Minor Magic at will (including all characters and NPCs with a class level), but arcane magic is otherwise limited to long, complex, and costly rituals. Clerics have limited spell-like abilities called prayers. True magic Items are almost non-existent. What true magic items do exist are created by the GM as needed and are always one-of-a-kind. Magic items created by binding spirits to material items are more common.

The proprietary setting these rules were designed for was centered around a large decadent empire which which was starting to fall apart at the seams while its borderlands were breaking away or were being overrun by subhumans and monsters. The central portions of the empire were ignoring the problems. The Church of Light was aware of the problems but its influence on the imperial government had been reduced by scandal after scandal. In the borderlands, however, the Church of Light was often the only institution able to see beyond local issues. The campaign world was early renaissance, at least in the central parts of the empire, but hand guns and long guns were never invented. However, the Microlite74 Light vs Dark rules will work fine for any setting with two powerful opposing deities and weak, but fairly common magic.

193604.name: Our Guardian Devils
193604.description:
User summary:

This game presents a very complex and unique setting with numerous supernatural forces that interact and complicate the lives of the characters. The core mechanic is fairly simple and utilizes d6 in pools. The game is a fusion of rules and setting that is used together to provide a distinct roleplaying experience.

193605.name: Shadows Over Sol: Ready-Made Heroes
193605.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to run a quick scenario, but don't have the time to write and stat out a full team? Are you starting up a new campaign, but your players don't know what they want to play? Here are nine pregenerated characters ready to experience the horrors of the Sol system!
