193719.description: Brazilian gaming personality, Azaghal, from the Jovem Nerd website (http://jovemnerd.com.br), now fights against the zombies. This survivor/zombivor character is a promo that was made readily available in Brazil.
193719.name: Zombicide Survivor: Azaghal

193720.description: This box was specially made for Brazilian website, Jovem Nerd (http://jovemnerd.com.br) and contains a three-mission campaign with special "gaming night" rules, exclusive dice and miniatures. All you need to have a nice Zombicide night! This Gaming Night Kit features the Brazilian personalities, Jovem Nerd and Azaghal. It includes 3 survivor and zombivor miniatures of each new character, the dashboard, a skull tracker, and 6 special green Zombicide dice.
193720.name: Zombicide: Gaming Night #5 – Bluehand Protocol

193721.name: Wyrd Chronicles (Issue 20 - Oct 2015)
193721.description:
(publisher blurb)

In this issue:

A Bad Penny: A story about bad things happening...
Meat Market: A Through the Breach location
Age Before Beauty: Yan Lo versus Colette!
The Blood Moon: A Halloween themed Malifaux scenario
Dancing Queen: Painting up the ever lovely Lola from the Dark Carnival
Good Faith: A quick Through the Breach one shot
By Yan Lo's Beard: Everyone could use some assembly tips now and again
Not Quite What The Doctor Ordered: A humorous story involving the good Doctor McMourning
All Work, Cosplay: More cosplay goodness!

193722.name: Wyrd Chronicles (Issue 21 - Dec 2015)
193722.description:
(publisher blurb)

In this issue:

Forged in Darkness: Aionus visits Plague
Creating a TTB Adventure: A helpful guide for Fatemasters
Fun with Scheme Markers: Win more games by (1) Interacting with this article!
The Fickle Whims of Time: An Aionus-themed Malifaux scenario
My Very Own Time Lord: Painting up Aionus
Cold Front: A TTB one shot
Someone Else's Toys: Crime never pays
Plan for the Best: A Malifaux tactics article

193723.name: Miner Mayhem
193723.description:
Pickaxe ready? Coal, iron, gold & diamond! Unlock miners and get treasures while avoiding rocks.

Source: The Developer Website.

193725.name: Blood & Plunder
193725.description:
Description from the publisher:

Brandish your cutlass and musket, and prepare for swashbuckling and adventure on the Spanish Main! Whether you're marching your pirate army across the Isthmus of Panama as legendary pirate Henry Morgan or terrorizing the Jamaican coasts as the infamous Captain Rivero, Blood & Plunder is a game set in the caribbean during the 17th century that is guaranteed to evoke thrills and capture the imagination of miniature gamers. This 30mm miniatures game boasts:


A compelling and intuitive rule set
The highest quality models of its genre
Masterfully crafted mechanics which allow for seamless transition between land and naval battles
Endless scenario possibilities
Consultation from world renowned historian and author Bennerson Little (Black Sails, Fortune's Whelp) to ensure that all models, campaigns and strategies reflect the period

193726.name: PlayStation Move Sharp Shooter
193726.description:
An accessory for the PlayStation Move motion controller that adapts both the motion controller and navigation controller into a submachine gun form, which features an adjustable shoulder support. The motion controller is fitted into the gun barrel so that the motion controller's T trigger is interlocked with the trigger, and the navigation controller is clipped into a holder below this gun barrel. However, the accessory goes far deeper by adding several extra buttons and controls via the EXT connector on the base of the Move Motion Controller.

Source: Wikipedia, "PlayStation Move", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193727.name: Absolute War! - The Attack on Russia 1941-45
193727.description:
From the publisher's website:
"After tackling the Russian Front with the first game of the No Retreat! Series, wargamer and designer Carl Paradis revisits this fascinating campaign with: Absolute War! - The Attack on Russia 1941-44. This two-player wargame recreates the titanic struggle between the invading armies of Nazi Germany versus the Soviet Union in a fresh new way. This new approach is even faster and easier to play - making it perfect for introducing new gamers to the hobby.
The design emphasis has been placed on making the game very player-friendly and manageable in its level of scope, difficulty and time of play. With a very low total counter count and density, this quick playing (while still realistic) simulation presents players with deep strategy meriting contemplation. A system of map areas has been adopted and movement has been streamlined. Combat is handled by the two decks of cards (one German and one Soviet) - meaning no combat tables or dice to roll. These cards are the crux of the game system offering even more variety than regular Combat Result Tables. Like in “No Retreat!” they are used to generate events and special game abilities (ex: Major Offensives, Partisan Raids, Siege Artillery, Increased Replacements, etc…) and now also effortlessly resolve all battle outcomes. The set-up for a campaign or a scenario will be lightning fast: in less than 10-15 minutes you can get the game going! This high degree of re-playability means that it will reward players' experience with increased skill.

Absolute War! will put emphasis on strategic planning - not tedious hex maneuvering or factor-counting to attain the “perfect” attack. Most of the time-consuming calculations will be taken care of effortlessly by the game engine, letting you concentrate instead on exercising your generalship skills against your opponent. Area-movement will provide the proper feel of sweeping maneuvers, exploitation and encirclements across the vast steppes and forests of Russia. The grueling city sieges will be represented by allowing local battles to unfold, with sometimes both foes occupying and battling in the same critical map areas. With a simple – yet effective - economic model, players will also feel the growing might and sophistication of the Soviet Red Army and the degradation of the once-invincible German Wehrmacht over the epic four years that this merciless campaign was fought on the soil of “Mother Russia”.

Victory conditions are simple and to the point: you have to capture as many of the ten map objectives to force a campaign decision. While destroying the foe’s armies will also help in this endeavor, some event cards will also provide short-term goals to accomplish - gaining players’ special game advantages if met.

Neither side can afford to show mercy to their hated foe in this life-or-death conflict, you are in command in the largest and most grueling campaign the world has ever seen. War is hell, and this is Absolute War!
Four Quick-Playing Scenarios plus a Campaign Game:


Barbarossa, 1941 : The initial assault on the Soviet Union. Can the Germans take Leningrad and Moscow before “General Winter” freezes the German war machine dead in its tracks?
Fall Blau & Operation Saturn, 1942 : The Offensive towards the Caucasus Oil Fields, and the Nazis disastrous rendezvous with destiny at Stalingrad . Or…maybe the OKH will decided to strike north again at the Soviet Capital?
Operation Zitadelle, 1943: Hitler’s last chance at getting a “victory” of sorts in the East after last winter disaster in the south. It’s a do-or-die proposition for the Germans, as the Red Army can finally fight on equal terms. Will Kursk be the tombstone of the Panzers?
Operation Bagration, 1944: The Soviet summer offensive that finally broke the back of the Wehrmacht, and made the Normandy landings look like a mere scuffle. Will you finally expel the hated foe enemies from their last foothold in Mother Russia?


Absolute War Campaign game: From Operation Barbarossa in 1941 to the aftermath of Bagration in 1944. The whole conflict up to the gates of Germany is played out in dramatic fashion.
Playing time: Approximately 3 - 4 hours for a full campaign game, 1- 2 hours for the Shorter Scenarios.
Scale: Each unit is one Army/Front: Each area is about 200 kilometers from side to side. Each turn represents two months of real time."

193728.description:
From GMT's website:

"At that time all members of the assembly, along with the proud tyrant, are blinded; such is the protection they find for their country (it was, in fact, its destruction) that those wild Saxons, of accursed name, hated by God and men, should be admitted into the island, like wolves into the folds, in order to repel the northern nations. Nothing more hurtful, certainly, nothing more bitter, happened to the island than this [...]"

Gildas (De Excidio Britanniae, Part I.23)

So wrote the 6th Century AD British monk Gildas in his pamphlet De Excidio Britanniae (“On the Ruin of Britain”) about what had befallen the Romano-British lands. This crucial period in history saw the end of the Roman Empire in Britain and the seeds of the modern nations of England, Wales, Scotland, Ireland, and Brittany. Most of us know next to nothing about this period, but we know of its legends – from King Arthur and his knights, through Merlin, Vortigern and Hengest, Badon Hill and the Isle of Avalon, to St. Patrick and Niall of the Nine Hostages…

“For the fire of righteous vengeance, caused by former crimes, blazed from sea to sea, heaped up by the eastern band of impious men; and as it devastated all the neighboring cities and lands, did not cease after it had been kindled, until it burnt nearly the whole surface of the island, and licked the western ocean with its red and savage tongue. […]”
Gildas (De Excidio Britanniae, Part I.24)

Volume VIII in GMT’s COIN Series transports us into the 4th and 5th Centuries A.D. and to the embattled Isle of Britannia. Pendragon – The Fall of Roman Britain covers a century of history from the first large-scale raids of Irish, Pict, and Saxon raiders, to the establishment of successor kingdoms, both Celtic and Germanic. This sumptuous volume adapts the celebrated asymmetrical COIN engine to depict the political, military, religious, and economic struggles of Dark Ages Britain.

Shrouded in mists of myth and legend, this story so foundational to many national groups has been subject to many different narratives and interpretations. The traditional Victorian vision of brutal and violent conquest of Roman and Celtic Britain by Anglo-Saxon raiders and invaders now collides with modern historical views ranging from continuity of tribal rivalries to quasi-peaceful cohabitation and acculturation.

Pendragon leverages the tremendous flexibility of the COIN system, from dual events to dissimilar approaches and victory conditions, to capture the complexity of the period and let the players explore alternative narratives. Unlike earlier volumes, Pendragon is not about counterinsurgency per se, but focuses on the asymmetrical clashes between and among Romano-British authorities and Barbarian powers gnashing over the carcass of the Roman Empire, including:

Barbarian Raiders plundering the land and trying to surprise unwary towns and hillforts, then melting into hills or fens.
Expansion or decline of the Saxon Shore naval defense system to counter sea-borne raiders.
Authentic Late-Roman military doctrine—mighty but hard-to-replace cavalry tracking down raiding parties before they can return their booty home.
Accessible, powerful but fickle Foederati: barbarian warbands in Briton employ.
Nuanced battle system representing troop qualities and tactics.
Fortified strongholds that must be assaulted, besieged, or rebuilt to gain regional political control.
Civil wars, coups, religious shifts, and cultural assimilation.
Population movements over the generations, due to good administration, barbarian ravages, or climatic changes.
Epochal Events ranging from Roman usurpations on the continent to massive reprisals against barbarian homelands.
Evolution of rules and victory conditions throughout the game, as the still vivacious Roman Empire may or may not end with Britain fragmented among competing semi-barbarian proto-kingdoms.
A deck of 83 cards with gorgeous commissioned original art.
Short, medium, and full-length scenarios
Support for solitaire, 2-player, 3-player and 4-player experiences.

“They, moved, as far as was possible for human nature, by the tale of such a tragedy, make speed, like the flight of eagles, unexpected in quick movements of cavalry on land and of mariners by sea; before long they plunge their terrible swords in the necks of the enemies; the massacre they inflict is to be compared to the fall of leaves at the fixed time, just like a mountain torrent, swollen by numerous streams after storms, sweeps over its bed in its noisy course; […]”
Gildas (De Excidio Britanniae, Part I.17)

Each faction in Pendragon brings specific capabilities and challenges:

The Dux represent the original Roman Army in Britannia: with the most powerful units in the game and a network of strong fortresses ringing the island and tied by efficient roads, you must strive to preserve the stability and prosperity of the provinces and punish any interloper daring to challenge the peace. If you can build up your prestige and maintain order, you may be able to keep the island in the Empire, or at least united in a new post-Roman power. You can rely on the civilian militia to assist you, but—as your peerless cavalry dwindles—you must resort to the traditional Roman offer to barbarians of land for service in your forces as Foederati. As the decay of institutions conspires with the scheming of feckless civilians and the marauding of restless barbarians, you may find that the dream of Empire is dead. If so, with your once proud Army little more than another group of warlords, you still can strive to carve for yourself the most powerful kingdom alongside your new rivals.

The Civitates represent the Romanized aristocracy ruling the ancient Celtic tribes from lavish villas and prosperous Roman towns, chafing under the distant authority (and taxes) of Rome, mistrusting the uncultured and semi-Barbarian army, and yearning to settle century-old accounts with their neighbors. When the Barbarian storm comes down upon your island, you may find yourself woefully unprepared to cope—materially or culturally—and presented with a fundamental choice: strive to protect your lands, wealth, and way of life via the despised Army and untrustworthy Foederati, or sacrifice Roman comforts to face down the Barbarian challenge militarily and culturally through a return to Celtic traditions.

The Saxons represent various Germanic groups including Angles, Jutes, Frisians, and Franks who harried, settled, and eventually took over swaths of Britain. As outsiders, you face a steep challenge just to come ashore against the might of the Roman army and navy. You will chip away at the Saxon Shore system, ravage the provincial economy to weaken the Britons’ capability to wage war, and see some of your best warriors serve as Foederati (often against yourself), but recognize that the more Saxons living on the island—whoever their paymaster—the more opportunities for advancing your nation. Eventually, you must secure footholds, perhaps in the marshy fens of the eastern seaboard that so resemble your homelands, in order to wield your considerable military potential and challenge the old masters of these rich lands to create England.

The Scotti, named for the marauding groups of Irish raiders, also represent those Celts native to the island of Britain who differed from the romanized Civitates by remaining true (or reverting back) to the old ways. Often, the boundary between the two groups was porous... The biggest such group eventually formed the northern nation of the Picts, forebears of modern Scotland. As the Scotti, you see the disintegration of Roman Britain as an opportunity not so much to expand as to seize riches and renown to assert yourself at home. Raid ceaselessly, surprise and plunder poorly protected communities, kidnap for ransom, and show your military prowess against your unfortunate neighbors across the Irish Sea and Forth-Clyde isthmus… Then establish bases strategically along the enemy shores and entreat local hill tribes to reject post-Roman authority. But beware that your very advances will help give rise and limit your ability to grapple new powerhouses on the island!

"Kings were anointed, not in the name of God, but such as surpassed others in cruelty, and shortly afterwards were put to death by the men who anointed them, without any enquiry as to truth, because others more cruel had been elected. If, however, any one among them appeared to be of a milder disposition, and to some extent more attached to truth, against him were turned without respect the hatred and darts of all, as if he were the subverter of Britain;[...]"

Gildas (De Excidio Britanniae, Part I.21)

So as Britain, the Island of the Mighty, is engulfed in the din of swords and spears and the acrid smoke of burning thatch, will you join the packs of wolves who feast on the once proud Empire, or will you rally the Dragon standards of the Pen Ddraig, the Chief Dragon, lord of battles of the Britons, to try to preserve your people’s lands and wealth?

Components:
A 22” x 34” mounted game board
A deck of 83 playing cards
Over 300 red, dark blue, light blue, black, green, and gold wooden playing pieces
6 gray and 6 white wooden pawns
4 foldout Faction player aid sheets
2 foldout Non-player faction aid sheets
2 Sequence of Play and Battle aid sheets
A sheet of markers
Rulebook
Playbook
4 6-sided dice and 3 4-sided dice

Players: 1-4 (includes full solitaire system)

Map: Area Movement

Timescale: about 15 years per campaign between Epoch cards

Designer: Marc Gouyon-Rety

For an in-depth interview with the designer Marc Gouyon-Rety visit:
https://theplayersaid.com/2016/07/09/exclusive-1st-interview...

Developer and Series Creator: Volko Ruhnke
193728.name: Pendragon: The Fall of Roman Britain

193729.name: GAMERS Newspaper (Vol. 5, Issue 1 - Aug 2011)
193729.description:
(publisher blurb)

Free Publication from the creators of the D20 Girls Magazine.

Gaming Articles Monthly Editorials and Remarkable Stories.

193730.name: 16 Terrible Things
193730.description: 16 Terrible Things is a lightweight horror RPG designed to be easy to learn and fast paced. It uses a D16 for all mechanics.

193731.description:
Right to The White House is a comedic party game. Its cards are themed after the Republican 2016 primary debate. Each card includes a debate topic, a picture of a candidate, and a quote from a televised debate.

The game's starting tableau consists of a draw deck, a discard pile, and a hand of seven cards for each player. Players compete to be the first to discard all their cards, similar to Uno or Skip-Bo. Play proceeds in turns around a circle. Each player must discard or draw one card on his or her turn. Players can only discard a card if the debate topic marked on it matches the topic of the card on the top of the discard pile. When one player discards all their cards, each remaining player accrues points based on the number of cards left in their hand. The game is then reset and continues for three more rounds (or until one player's score exceeds an agreed maximum score).

Two special card types introduce a mechanic that requires all players to speak and act ultra-right wing at all times when playing. The Conservative Challenge cards allows one player to challenge another if they detect any behavior that is not sufficiently conservative (as judged by a vote of all other players). The loser of a Conservative Challenge must draw extra cards. A second special card, the Trump Card, allows players to automatically win any conservative challenge.
193731.name: Right to The White House

193732.name: 16 Impossible Things Before Breakfast
193732.description:
Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. - The White Queen from Lewis Carroll's Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There.

Upon walking one early morning, you and your companions have found yourselves stumbling upon a Mad Tea Party set up in the woods. Unfortunately for you, no one can leave; at least, not yet.

Now that you are there, you are obliged to stay and join in six conversations. A strange rule for a strange party. There are exactly sixteen concurrent conversations, so at least you will not be obliged to join them all!

There is another twist. Each attendee starts with six points of confusion - after all, a Mad Tea Party was not something you expected to find! Should you lose your confusion, you will be staying here, for it does not seem that odd at all. Should you gain more confusion, you will need to join in more conversations (equal to the number of your confusion) before you can leave.

Now that you have arrived, please do join in. After all, we are all mad here.

--From the Introduction

193733.name: Bravery Feats
193733.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Bravery defines the hero.

The fighter, more than any other class, is an exemplar of this truth, routinely facing down spell-hurling sorcerers, otherworldly monsters, even devils and demons, all with nothing but a slender piece of steel or wood with which to confront the roaring magics of these fearsome foes. This PDF presents a series of feats designed to showcase just how essential bravery can be to a warrior, influencing everything from leadership to the ability to deal with magical threats.

193736.name: Holodomor
193736.description:
User summary:

Holodomor is set during a particularly grim period of Ukrainian history when starvation was prevalent and forced deportations and land expropriations were common. Much of the game consists of mere survival in desperate conditions - for example, the equipment list notes individual food items with nutritional values.

205543.name: Star Trek Panic: Vulcan Mind-Meld Promo Card

boardgamehonor.40347: 2016 Golden Geek Best Cooperative Game Nominee

193737.description:
Star Trek Panic is a cooperative light strategy game based on Castle Panic that challenges players to defend the U.S.S. Enterprise from enemy attacks.

In addition, the game features mission cards that have unique challenges based on the original Star Trek series as well as character cards so that players can assume the roles of Star Trek icons like Captain Kirk and Mr. Spock.
193737.name: Star Trek Panic

225704.name: Great Western Trail: Promo Station Master Tiles

boardgamehonor.40555: 2016 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee

193738.description:
Description from the publisher:

America in the 19th century: You are a rancher and repeatedly herd your cattle from Texas to Kansas City, where you send them off by train. This earns you money and victory points. Needless to say, each time you arrive in Kansas City, you want to have your most valuable cattle in tow. However, the "Great Western Trail" not only requires that you keep your herd in good shape, but also that you wisely use the various buildings along the trail. Also, it might be a good idea to hire capable staff: cowboys to improve your herd, craftsmen to build your very own buildings, or engineers for the important railroad line.

If you cleverly manage your herd and navigate the opportunities and pitfalls of Great Western Trail, you surely will gain the most victory points and win the game.
193738.name: Great Western Trail

boardgameaccessory.216277: Great Western Trail: Player Mat Overlay

boardgamefamily.37838: Stronghold Games: The Great Designer Series

193739.description:
For several decades during the Viking age, parts of England were occupied by the Norsemen. Under their influence, one of the larger cities turned into a flourishing center of trade and craftsmanship. The Vikings called the city and its surrounding kingdom "Jórvík", which is today known as the city of York.

In the game Jórvík, players assume the roles of Viking jarls. They gather prestige points by trading goods, holding big feasts, funding pillages, commissioning craftsmen and hiring soldiers to defend the city against recurring invasions. The player with the most prestige points wins.

The game is a re-design of Die Speicherstadt (2010). In this game, players acquire cards from a card display through a simple yet brilliant worker placement and bidding mechanism to build up their trading empires. Jórvík includes two versions: A base game that is equivalent to Die Speicherstadt, and an advanced game that equates to Die Speicherstadt including its expansion Kaispeicher.
193739.name: Jórvík

boardgamefamily.37838: Stronghold Games: The Great Designer Series

193740.name: Penarium
193740.description:
Penarium is a frantic 2D arena arcade game where you control quirky anti-hero Willy. Willy is a kid trapped inside a sinister circus called; the Penarium. Willy's only hope of ever returning to his beloved father's farm is to run, jump and avoid an array of killer deathtraps while being cheered on by a sadistic crowd that is out for blood; his blood.

Penarium is set in a unique world; a sinister circus show where contestants, much like gladiators, are forced to entertain a sadistic crowd at the risk of losing their lives. Guide poor little Willy through this evil madness and become the champion of Penarium! Every kid wants to go to the circus but no kid wants to die in one...

Source: The Game Website.

193741.name: Hell
193741.description:
About the Game
Set in a mythical fantasy land you take control of either the ‘Order of Light’ or the ‘Demons of Hell’ and battle for supremacy across many different battlefields and environments. The game features stunning visuals and is aimed at both PC and iOS release with cross platform multiplayer functionality. Each unit in ‘Hell’ has been carefully designed to have a specific role in the battle, with various strengths and weaknesses determined from their unique abilities and traits.

Features

Explore vibrant fantasy realms, play through gorgeous vistas from lush forests, swamps and Hell itself.
Get into the action with intense skirmish combat, and use your tactics to outsmart your opponent.
Myriad layers of strategic features including, terrain characteristics, support units, zone of control, level up bonuses and special abilities!
Control a vast array of units from powerful Paladins and Gryphons to Demonic imps and Giant Behemoths from the very depths of Hell.
Your troops gain experience from successful attack and defend actions which can provide important boosts to units mid-battle.
Command an elite group of soldiers in an epic story driven campaign featuring both the defense of the realms of men and the invasion of Hell!
Varying mission objectives require a range of strategic skills, protect bases from being overrun, capture and control key points or simply wipe out the enemy forces.
Online Multiplayer, play against your friends or strangers in a wide array of multiplayer maps.
Quick to learn but an eternity to master, the depth and richness of the game contributes to a lasting appeal.




Source: The Publisher Website.

193742.name: Volume

videogamehonor.34959: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee

193742.description:
Locksley doesn't kill. That would be far too easy. Instead, he commits his crimes through stealth. Sneaking, distracting, avoiding. He is never seen, and seldom heard. As he grows in popularity and notoriety, so will his inventory. An arsenal of gadgets await discovery in a quest to rob from the rich and give to the unheard.

A hundred challenging and exciting levels lie ahead, but that is only the beginning of the Volume. The community are free to build their own challenges, even releasing their own takes on the core levels. Volume will evolve, warp and grow as players make their mark on Locksley's legend.

Volume is a near-future retelling of the Robin Hood legend, starring Danny Wallace (Thomas Was Alone), Charlie McDonnell and award-winning, critically-acclaimed actor Andy Serkis (The Lord of the Rings, Planet of the Apes) as Gisborne.

Source: The Game Website.

193744.name: The Great Glass Elevator
193744.description:
From the box:
Crash! With the most tremendous noise of splintering wood and broken tiles Mr Willie Wonka's Great Glass Elevator has just torn through the roof of his Chocolate Factory! Through the glass elevator floor, charlie can see all the doors to all the rooms...but they are mixed up! Which room is which? Each of your cards shows three lift buttons that lead to different rooms. Race around the factory, opening and closing doors as you go. And see if you can find the rooms in the order shown on your cards! The more buttons you can match, the further you'll go!

Match your card to all the rooms in Wonka's Chocolate Factory to win!

193745.name: Little People Memo
193745.description:
Memo with two levels of play, featuring George the Fireman to help.
Theme is based around occupations and related objects.

All the tiles are laid face down, each player takes it in turn to show two cards. In the first level the cards have to match i.e. Tennis player & Tennis player. In the second level, the players match the occupation with its object i.e. Tennis player & Racket.

Once a player has made a match they can place George on any tile to help them remember a tile. With each matched pair, George can be moved.

Once all the tiles have been claimed, the player with the most matched pairs wins!

193746.name: Street Gang
193746.description:
From the back of the game

Have you got what it takes?

Kick and punch your way through New York City's violent crime ridden streets, ghettos and sewers, in this explosive all action combat simulation.

193747.name: Little People ABC
193747.description:
Alphabet game with two levels of play, featuring Marie to help.

The mini game board is assembled and all the letter tokens are sorted into 4 matching coloured piles. Each player is dealt an even number of books. Players take it in turns to roll the die and move Marie around the track. Pick a coloured tile matching the space and call it out. In the first level the players can use the pictures and letters to recognise the letters. In the second level, only the letters can be used.

Once a player has completed all their books they win!

193748.name: Little People Dominos
193748.description:
Dominos with two levels of play, featuring Sonia to help.
Theme is based around animals and vets making them better.

Each player gets 4 dominos to start, the rest are placed in stock. One tile is used from the stock to start the game. Players take it in turns to match the animals building a chain from either end. Once a player has placed all their tiles. Sonia is placed on the last tile and no more tiles are laid.

A Heart token is now placed on any animal with a bandage. Players now roll the die and any heart token they pass over or land on they pick up.

Once all the hearts have been picked up the player with the most wins!

The second level is played using the paw print side (players have to count the number of paws to make a match).

193749.name: Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective – The Case of the Mummy's Curse
193749.description:
Holmes and Watson learn about a series of mysterious deaths of three men who were part of an archeology trip to Egypt. Each man was found strangled with a sheath of a mummy's wrapping present at each murder. The London Times believes the deaths were caused by an ancient mummy, creating public hysteria. Holmes and Watson decide take on the case to find the real culprit but they face a challenge since only one murder was in London while another was in Egypt and another was at sea.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes%3A_Consulting_Detective Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193750.name: Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective – The Case of the Mystified Murderess
193750.description:
Francis Nolan is found hovering over the body of her lover, Guy Clarendon, in a London hotel with a pistol in her hand. She's convicted of Guy's murder, despite having no memory of ever being there, nor purchasing the gun that was bought in her name. She insists that she's innocent as Holmes and Watson take on the case to see if she is telling the truth. Along the way, Holmes and Watson learn about Guy Clarendon's dark past.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes%3A_Consulting_Detective Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193751.name: Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective – The Case of the Tin Soldier
193751.description:
An old general is murdered in his home by a mysterious visitor who quickly vanishes from the scene of the crime. Holmes and Watson investigate to see whether the crime was due to the general's part in a Veteran Tontine, a book he was writing on a missing diamond, a disgruntled marriage, or something hidden deep in his past.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sherlock_Holmes%3A_Consulting_Detective Sherlock Holmes: Consulting Detective]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193752.name: Princess.Loot.Pixel.Again
193752.description:
User Summary

You choose from a class of fighter/wizard and explore a platform dungeon, defeating enemies, unlocking treasure and items, all the time searching for the exit. Ultimately you seek to explore the entire Dark Tower and face the final boss. The art and music is retro.

193753.name: Posthuman: BGG Promo
193753.description: This 5 card set includes 2 new followers (The Hunter and The Hound) and 3 new weapons (Ripper Jack, FABS - Executioner, and The Rapier). These 5 cards were given to ALL Kickstarter supporters and are only available now via the BGG Store or possibly via the publishers at tradeshows.

193754.name: Chronicles of a Dark Lord Episode II
193754.description:
User Summary

The continuation of this JRPG begins in the middle of the action with your warriors fighting a boss, but the ensuing cut-scene suggests that victory was not complete.

193755.name: Don't Bug Me!
193755.description:
The big ol' hungry Bug is out to ruin your picnic! The player who defends his/her food the longest, by blocking him from their corner of the picnic blanket, is the WINNER!

The game uses a large, fast, battery powered bug that moves around the game board erratically, while players use a plastic hand piece to block the bug from hitting their pie. The hand piece re-directs the bug towards their fellow picnickers and away from their own food. The bug moves back and forth around the board until a player fails to block it. When all 4 food pieces are knocked out of position for a player, they are out of the game. Play proceeds until there is only one player left with any food untouched.

193756.name: Otherworld: Etherium Forge
193756.description:
From the publisher:

Can you wield the power of the Etherium Forge to summon ancient Artifacts and Spells to defeat your enemies? Or will you fall, like many before you?

Otherworld: Etherium Forge is a card-and-dice battle game for 2-4 players that lasts around 30 minutes.

There are a wide variety of possible strategies, but it’s always good to plan ahead. How do you want to win the game? Building many small Artifacts and overwhelming your opponent? Using Veilstones to empower a Spell like Elemental Storm? Quietly building a high Victory Pile and hoping to go unnoticed? Try to outthink your opponent!

Will I Like This Game?
You will enjoy Etherium Forge if you like:

Simultaneous turns so you always stay in the action.
Adding physical and mental dexterity to a card game.
Using dice combinations to solve mini puzzles.
A fast game, often about 30-40 minutes with 4 players and still offers a lot of strategy.
A competitive game that is cutthroat.
Compact design, good for travel.
Easy to learn, but difficult to master.
An affordable game.

193772.name: Fairune
193772.description:
An action-puzzler RPG with a retro feel!
The scourge is back with a vengeance! Seal him off for good!
Collect the three Spirit Icons to lead the way to victory!

- A gorgeous, nostalgic pixel art world!
- A fantastic chiptune soundtrack!
- An expansive adventure featuring 100 screens of action!
- Unique monsters and lots of puzzles to solve!
- Scoreboards: try your best time in a speedrun!
- Best of all, it's free!

Source: The Developer Website.

193773.name: Cubicle Quest
193773.description:
User Summary

This JRPG-looking game is about life in a regular job. You fight the Debt Alliance, paying down student debt and --I'm not making this up-- fighting enemies using office talents, like interpersonal skills. You drift into a fantasy realm from your life and job but the issues are from modern life.

193774.name: City of Chains
193774.description:
User Summary

This scifi RPG follows a prison breakout by an engineer who leads a group of detainees to overthrow the city goverment. Progress leads to new skills but there is neither levelling nor experience points. There are skills and crafting, branching storylines and team morale.

193775.description:
The Eclipse Technology Trayz is one piece and only used during the game. This is not a storage solution but holds the tech tiles drawn throughout the course of game play.

Simply pass the Eclipse Tech Custom Tray to the player taking a technology action and they can pick one in the comfort of their own chair. This expansion version also includes the round marker spots, extra spots for tiles used in the Eclipse Expansion: Rise of the Runelords. The Trayz have easy push and tilt cavities for easy tile removal.
193775.name: Eclipse: Rise of the Ancients – Technology Tray

rpg.1297: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

193776.name: Old School Dungeons: Crypt of the Dread Lord
193776.description:
(publisher blurb)

What horrors await within the burial crypt of the fabled Dread Lord? Who among you are foolish enough to brave the depths of this mysterious dungeon?

In this Old School Dungeon you will find a map of an ancient crypt, although it is designed to be generic enough to fit a multitude of uses.

193777.name: Adventure Seeds for Ravenlands 1
193777.description:
(publisher blurb)

While these adventure seeds could be used for any fantasy game, they were specifically designed for our The Ravenlands map series, found right here at RPGNow and DriveThruRPG.

193778.name: Adventure Seeds for Ravenlands 2
193778.description:
(publisher blurb)

While these adventure seeds could be used for any fantasy game, they were specifically designed for our The Ravenlands map series, found right here at RPGNow and DriveThruRPG.

193780.name: Jute the Immortal Dragoon
193780.description:
From the introduction:

This warrior has roamed the world for so long that he has forgotten his real name and where he came from. He searches the world for answers and fights for causes he feels are just.

193781.name: Blood in Space: Boot Camp
193781.description:
(publisher blurb)

Blood In Space: Bootcamp is a light version of the core rulebook. This free document was created to give Game masters and players a chance to experience the universe before continuing on to the main rulebook.

Bootcamp introduces the GM and the player as marines with a mission to the planet of Maanik-Kruste dealing with terrorists on the planet's surface.

193782.name: Vendetta (2005)
193782.description:
From the introduction:

Imagine the world of Russ Meyer, mashed up with the nasty revenge horror of the late seventies. It is set in somewhere in the southern states of America, probably Texas, Arizona, Nevada or California. The characters are all young women, usually very foxy, large-breasted and wasp-waisted, but still by and large, independent and powerful. They are all friends, although there may be tensions within the group. One of them is The Girlfriend. She has a boyfriend who is a lowdown good-for-nothing punk. He's done something bad... real bad. And now our girls want revenge...

193783.name: Manuel d'Itinérance
193783.description:
User Summary

This is the core rule book for Shaan Renaissance

Shaan Renaissance is a science fantasy RPG. It is the rebirth of French RPG Shaan.

Far far away in the galaxy, the planet Heos and its 9 humanoid species had a peaceful life. But humans came, with violence and destruction. Two centuries later, they own the planet, its magic and life and death over the people of Heos. Resistance forms.

The only hope is Shaan...

193784.name: Kit d'Initiation
193784.description:
User Summary

This is the beginners kit for Shaan Renaissance

Shaan Renaissance is a science fantasy RPG. It is the rebirth of French RPG Shaan.

Far far away in the galaxy, the planet Heos and its 9 humanoid species had a peaceful life. But humans came, with violence and destruction. Two centuries later, they own the planet, its magic and life and death over the people of Heos. Resistance forms.

The only hope is Shaan...

193785.name: Écran du meneur
193785.description:
User Summary

The GM screen for Shaan Renaissance

Contains:
- 3 panels screen with colour illustration
- The scenario L’Histoire sans faim (16 pages)

193786.name: Witch Hunted
193786.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all Adepts, or magically-awakened people. In the world, Adepts are hunted and feared. Characters have a single Trait, called Power, that varies from 0 to 100, starting at 20. The goal of the game is to amass 100 Power points in order to transcend the mortal plane.

193787.name: Majik
193787.description: From the back of the box: The time has come to depart, for you must seek out and rescue Prince Gideon from the evil clutches of Dolmir and so prevent Dolmir's intended domination of the Haven of the Western Reaches.

193788.name: Curling Dice Game
193788.description:
A dicegame for 2 players with a Curling theme

Each player has 8 dice in their color.

Players alternate their turns by first calling "Draw" or "Take Out" and then roll 1 dice. The object is to have more dice with
lower values than your opponent.

193789.description: An additional dragon, with a unique level 2 upgrade ability option. Files provided freely by the publisher, and unpainted meeple made available separately.
193789.name: Wrath of Dragons: Copper Dragon

193790.name: Tinga Tinga Tales: Swinging Monkey Race Game
193790.description:
Join the Tinga Tinga Tales Monkeys as they swing from tree to tree and be the first monkey to reach the finish line.

Create your own game path of trees - make it straight or curvy. Roll the dice to match the fruit to swing from tree to tree. Land on another monkey tale and hold them up a turn. First monkey to swing through all 15 trees wins.

boardgamecompilation.174122: But Wait, There's More!: Fantasy RPG Mini-Expansion

193791.description:
The Geek Expansion is a pack of three mini expansions:

Fantasy RPG Mini-Expansion
Superhero Mini-Expansion
Video Game Mini-Expansion

Every mini-expansion contains six new features and four new products that can be added to the appropriate game decks separately or combined.
193791.name: But Wait, There's More!: Geek Expansion

193792.description:
Arcole 1796 focuses on the three days of an indecisive battle in northern Italia (15th to 17th November 1796). It includes 3 scenarios of one day and a campaign game of 3 days.

Arcole 1796 is the 41st battle of the Jours de Gloire series.

Bonaparte is at the head of the French Army of Italy. Alvinczy commands the Austrian Army.

This Jours de Gloire module introduces a new type of terrain - the Dike - and very particular tactical options as the battlefields is made of marshes and rice fields, with dikes as only ways for developing maneuvers.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).
193792.name: Arcole 1796

193793.name: Hi-Ho! Gator Race
193793.description:
From the back of the box:

Hi-Ho and away we go! It's learning fun the GOLDEN way as children race two alligators around a plastic game tray, taking turns matching colors on the Gators' backs. Designed to help children learn to recognize and match basic colors, Hi-Ho! Gator Race combines fun and learning, offering a snapping good time for all.

193794.name: Stanford The Game
193794.description:
User summary:

You are a new student at Stanford. The object of the game is to graduate (by accumulating 180 or more units) and become the most successful. Success is measured by three different criteria: Final GPA, Social Stature, and Resume Stars.

Players make a few decisions on paths to follow, but the game is largely dice rolling luck. Strategically little more advanced than Candyland or Chutes & Ladders. You do get to travel around a campus map. Probably ONLY of any interest to Stanford grads and fans.

Flimsy and shoddy components and construction.

193795.name: Balancing Burger!
193795.description:
From the publisher:

Build it tall, don't let it fall. Players take turns rolling the die and adding ingredients according to the number rolled. The higher the burger the harder to add ingredients without making the burger fall.

193796.description:
Agents & Operatives is a board game of epic conflict between the world's most covert powers: The Agents, The Operatives, and various deadly Mercenary groups for 4-8 players!

NEWS FLASH: Global intelligence indicates imminent international safety threats! In response, leading nations convened to combine their top spy agencies' forces into a single elite counter-terrorism Agency Faction [Codename: WATCHDOG], their Agents’ mission -- identify and eliminate all Operative threats to mankind.

In response to this alliance, leading evil Operative organizations agreed to collaborate under a single terrorist umbrella Faction, S.H.A.D.O.W. Their plan -- infiltrate vital international Zones to eliminate Agents for global control. The combat stakes are at an all-time high as both the Agents and the Operatives seek to eliminate each other.

Meanwhile, skilled Mercenary Factions operate in the shadows of strife, seeking to strategically maneuver within the embattled Zones for their own gain. However, what is unknown yet to all is that all lines of communication within the Zones has collapsed, so no one will know who their allies or enemies are upon entry...

Control your Faction’s field Units, retrieve vital Intel to discover your Allies and Enemies, and enter restricted Zones to gather Weapons, Gadgets, and trigger Location effects with major Global ramifications. Agents & Operatives is a unique combination of secret team/social deduction gaming and worker placement design featuring spatial strategy and upgrade management to create a thrilling, combative, and unforgiving real-time espionage experience from your chair.

Danger has never been higher and trust never lower.
193796.name: Agents & Operatives

193797.name: Empire
193797.description:
The wargame with miniatures. The box contains map of ancient world, miniatures, a two six-sided dices, markers of flags and money, bookrule.

You can conquer the ancient world using simple rules and pretty miniatures.

Players may conquer neutral or opponnent's provinces, get taxes from them, build forces (infantry, cavalry, chariots, elephants), fleets, fortresses.

Armies can fight under overlord command only.

Quality of overlords are restricted and players should care about them.

Simple combat system uses a two 6-sided dices to determinate "licky" bonus

The player who conquers the all provinces is winner.

193798.name: Find the Link
193798.description: Party game based on UK BBC television game show that aired from 1954 to 1956. Two players are secretly given details of an imaginary link between them and other players have to deduce it. A chairperson is required to moderate. The game contains cards with six links, including backgrounds, and cards for the chairperson and panelists.

193799.name: Way of Gold and Steel
193799.description:
User Summary

Real Time Strategy meets Roguelike in this game that has you telling characters what to do and an inventory. You guide a small civilization to greater growth, knowing that if you fail in some regard, you'll have to start the game over.

193800.name: Lovecraft Country
193800.description:
A text-based, multiplayer, online role playing game, Lovecraft Country has a social rather than combat-oriented focus. The game recreates the horror genre thrills of settings inspired by the works of H.P. Lovecraft (1890–1937) and other authors who have followed in his style.

Source: Introductory comic on the publisher's website.

193801.name: The Moaning Words
193801.description:
Set in the infamous Cthulhu Mythos, The Moaning Words is a tribute to a writer we are deeply in love with: H.P Lovecraft. It is a free to play game, available on smartphones, tablets (Android and iOS first), and web browsers. It is in English and French (more languages will come later).

Written by Science Fiction author Alan Dean Foster, The Moaning Words is a dark investigation composed of 18 episodes released daily. With hours of gameplay and reading, this investigation is packed with many innovative features:

Interactive storytelling
Social reading and cooperation
Narrative card games
Illustrated riddles

Source: The Developer's Kickstarter Page.

193802.name: Get Adler: Whispers
193802.description:
This intriguing expansion adds The Mole (player 7) and French Agent Bonnet (player 8).

The objective of The Mole is to pass vital information to Adler (and Kate Collins), while the mission of Gigi Bonnet is to intercept enemy communications and pass that intelligence to her colleagues.

193803.name: Fireside Tales
193803.description:
From the publisher:
Fireside Tales is a collaborative storytelling game for 4 to 8 players. The goal of the game is to tell an enjoyable story together by suggesting appropriate story elements represented by the cards you play. If you wish to win, in addition to hearing an awesome story, suggest the cards that fit the story best - so that the other players choose to incorporate them in the story. Whoever gets the most elements into the story is the victor.

Imagine Once Upon a Time meets Cards Against Humanity, then add deeper storytelling and wacky rules - and you'll get Fireside Tales.

193805.name: A Song Without End
193805.description:
User summary:

The most distinctive aspect of the game involves the player and characters relationship. Each player creates and controls an entire family as characters, though one family member is designated as the primary. These characters are described by narrative tags.

The game master role also is peculiar inasmuch as the role controls a single persona, representative of the state police.

193806.name: Homeka: Kit de découverte
193806.description:
User Summary

This a French Science-Fiction game. In French

This is the discovery kit, freely downloadable. The 27 pages PDF contains:
- simplified rules
- ready to play characters
- a scenario

In the future....

Two hundred years ago, the blue planet, the moon Zephyr, is discovered on the other side of the Galaxy and soon a stellar gate is build for mega corporations to exploit its resources, including water.

The gate is attacked, become unstable and the mega corporations hurry to repatriate their most precious assets. As the gate finally explode, a large number of personnel and hardware is left behind on the planet, as well as desolation and scorched lands.

After a generation, survivors have managed to rebuild a fragile society. And among the equipment left on the planet are these Mekas, gigantic bipedal robots that were once used by the corporations.

34 years after the rupture, there are fears that the corporations may come back. These fears create tensions, reveal loyalties and generate conflicts among the people. The PCs are part of a crew of one of these Mekas, struggling to keep them going, taking any job they can, being on their own and against other Mekas, where the battle just create destruction ; this is not without counting about the gangs of solar jeeps that tries to steal the precious Mekas.

The game system is designed to allow player interaction based on where they are placed around the table and to deal with the operation of the machine.

193808.name: Weres: The Accursed
193808.description:
User summary:

This "mini-system" adds rules for playing shapeshifting were creatures in the Ysgarth Rules System. The rules can be used for player characters or non-player characters.

193809.name: Defenders of the Union
193809.description:
From the introduction:

Defenders of the Union is a role-playing game in which you play the part of a member of the feared secret police of a future USSR, a man or women sent (along with their colleagues) to root out dissent and treason within a community. Direct orders from the Supreme Soviet instruct you to use any and all methods and means to root out enemies of the people and restore harmony and correct thought.

193810.name: American Football (1984)

videogameversion.301017: English / European Amstrad CPC (Top Ten re-release) Cassette edition

193810.description:
From the inlay

American Football. Nominated as "Coach of the Year" last year, you have the freedom of coaching any of the premier American Football teams. Your price? Well it's difficult to say, but one thing is sure, the team you will coach will give you a pre-season working capital of $250,000. What you do with it is up to you.

Play the game: select your squad; beat the transfer market; beat the bank.

All you have to do is field the best team at the best time and make money! If you're good enough, then win the Superbowl.

Here's lookin' at ya, kid ... Go for it!

User Summary

This is a very simple management game. The programmers either had a poor understanding of American Football or had to significantly simplify in order to fit within the limitations of 8-bit computers. The player is asked to select one of two divisions, each of eight teams. In 1984, the NFL was actually made up of 28 teams across 6 divisions, so many teams are not depicted.

The management consists of buying players on the transfer market (taking bank loans if required) and then swapping members of your team before the match to balance skill, energy and morale. You have 11 players on your team and 4 in reserve. There is no concept of different positions, offence or defence.

The player has no control over the matches, the game simply shows highlights. Only a passing game is depicted, and only touchdowns are scored (for which 7 points are awarded - there is no kicking of extra points). No field goals are shown.

Position in the league is based on the British system of 3 points for a win, 1 for a draw and 0 for a loss, rather than the American system of Win-Loss-Tie.

193811.name: Hexagon Universe

rpgissuearticle.158317: On y a joué: Hexagon Universe

193811.description:
User Summary

This is the core rulebook. It includes:
- Introduction to the shared universe
- Rules for hero creation and a simple rule system
- C.L.A.S.H.
- CRIMEN
- A scenario
- A bibliographic reference

Hexagon Universe is a French RPG to play super heroes in the universe of Hexagon, a comic book universe created in the 60s in France by Marcel Navarro and published by Lug.

The heroes will be members of C.L.A.S.H., a UN organization dedicated to protect Earth, and will fight CRIMEN, the criminal organization.

Characters are created with a concept, a few attributes, motivations, talents and power. Actions are resolved by a pool of dice.

193812.name: Strangers: Les Entités Cosmiques
193812.description:
User Summary

This is the first Strangers supplement for Hexagon Universe.

It describe cosmic entities and their realities l the Sopharques, time guardians ; the Tours, expansionist entities through 3 galaxies ; the Zade builders, now long gone but whose remnants last.

Also includes a limited edition comic.

193813.description:
Promo card

Divine Prophecy. (4 cost card)

elder may examine the next 3 trial cards and return them to the top of the pile in any order.

acts 21:10-14
193813.name: Commissioned:  Divine Prophecy

193814.name: Strangers: Les Empires Galactiques
193814.description:
User Summary

This is the second Strangers supplement for Hexagon Universe.

It contains:
- the civilizations found in the milky way and the empires that developed
- Alpha, one of the oldest civilizations
- Kyros, the most feared military power
- Aréna and the Trident famous for its circus games
- The Galactic Federation and its solid alliances
- A scenario

193815.name: Robowars
193815.description:
User Summary

Similar to Plants vs. Zombies, you defend your base using resource gathering equipment and weapons. There is a Soviet Union theme but due to the devs disappearing, the game tends to be buggy and unpolished.

193816.name: Quill: Love Letters

rpg.33381: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player

193816.description:
(publisher blurb)

Since early civilisation, love letters have been written to express our romantic feelings in a way that could only be articulated in the form of a missive. These messages are among the trickiest to write, usually with the aim of receiving a similar response from the sender's sweetheart. In love letter-writing, there is a fine line between winning a heart and having your own broken.

Love Letters is a collection of five new scenarios for Quill, all themed around the heart. You will be trying to win the hearts of aristocrats, professing love to a dear friend, persuading overseas lovers to cross the ocean for you, and more.

193817.name: Scenarii
193817.description:
User Summary

Scenarii is a collection of 52 never published scenarios for any medieval fantasy game. It comes with a simple Cross Games system that allow making the reference to convert these to your favourite games as well some "generic" rules to resolve specific situations.

A short 11 pages introduction to the universe allow setting up the world to these 52 adventures - including 4 campaigns.

193818.description:
¿Would you like to play a basketball match on a table at home?
Now you can...

BASKETBALL age is a basketball simulator for 2 persons that recreates an exciting basketball match.

You´re one of the two team coaches facing off. You have to choose your “starting lineup” on the court to win the match. As in a normal match, your players will move around a basketball court, divided in zones where the players perform basketball actions.

Each player has his own skills (play skill, movement points, passing, scoring % and height). Players skills are different according to their position.

Court players are activated and perform their actions one by one and in alternating way (attacker-defender and so on) until the end of possession or turn over. Attacking team has a turn to score. It consists of 10 attacking player´s activation, or the buzzer will sound. You can activate the same player in a row as many times as you want.

Following a simple rules and rolling dice (six sided and ten sided dice) you´ll be able to perform all kind of basketball actions like passes, rebounds, fouls, freethrows, blocks, pick& roll, steals, two-point shots, lay ups, three-pointers, dunks....

¿Have you got what it takes to lead your team to victory?
193818.name: Basketball Age

193819.name: Enid Blyton's Little Noddy Party Game
193819.description: Players race to find hidden images in three pictures of Noddy's world.

193821.name: Under Fogbreath Peak
193821.description:
From the publishers page:

A Stone Giant needs your help. His clan was slaughtered by a mad wizard who now lairs among its bones. He wants revenge. Can you survive the warrens beneath Fogbreath Peak?

193822.description:
The classic party game of kings with a piratical twist.

Players take turns drawing cards to reveal their fate. Will it be a singin' contest, or a walk o' the plank? If ye be lucky, ye might add a rule to the Pirate Code and force your crewmates into all manner o' silliness, but beware being Keelhauled and don't forget the Mop Bucket...
193822.name: Pirate Kings

193823.description: The Viticulture Moor Visitors Expansion, designed by famed designer Uwe Rosenberg (Agricola, Caverna, Patchwork) and Viticulture designers Jamey Stegmaier and Alan Stone, adds 40 new visitors to any version of Viticulture. Also included are corrected reprints of the Promoter and Harvest Machine cards.
193823.name: Viticulture: Moor Visitors Expansion

193824.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks.
There are new options in the rules to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
193824.name: Dickensian Intrigue (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

193825.name: Kidnapped
193825.description:
User Summary

You wake up in a old house and explore to discover an exit and clues to unlocking rooms. There are weapons and lockpicks but most of the game is combing the 19th century mansion for puzzle solutions.

193826.name: Human Extinction Simulator
193826.description:
User Summary

A lot like a Euro-boardgame, your spaceships battle other spaceships across a hex map.

193827.name: Gunslugs
193827.description:
User Summary

Almost retro, this action game has you run, jump, and shoot your way across the screen to kill enemy soldiers and technology. The more 21st century aspects are permadeath and procedurally generated levels.

193828.name: Madness and Mayhem
193828.description:
User summary:

Madness and Mayhem presents a modern-style live-action role-playing game that prefers cinematic style and fast action while also supporting table-top style action resolutions for complex actions or significant opposed action resolution.

193829.name: Greyfox
193829.description:
User Summary

You are living in the town of Greyfox and are able take over the bodies of other people, making moral choices for them. The graphics and music are JRPG styled.

193830.name: Bloodbath Kavkaz
193830.description:
User Summary

This top-down action game is set in Moscow among drug gangs. The eighties styled music and blurry camera swaying visuals are reminscent of Hotline Miami, but the execution is far less successful.

193831.name: Colorfox
193831.description: In Colorfox, players place cards on the table to collect matchsticks in six different colors. When you connect to multiple other cards, you can also trade your matchsticks with an opponent (who cannot refuse). This goes on until the matchsticks of one color run out, then you count the scores. Each set of different colored matchsticks is scored separately, then these scores are added together. A set of six gives 21 points, five 15 points, four 10 points, three 6 points, two 3 points, and a lone matchstick 1 point. Whoever scores the most points wins.

193832.name: The Logomancer
193832.description:
User Summary

A JRPG that favours negotiation and words over fighting and killing, the story revolves around the dream world or MindScape, and the people who create this world, Logomancers

193833.name: Rough Cuts: 6 Micro Games
193833.description:
(publisher blurb)

Rough Cuts is a collection of six micro games. Each is designed to be read and digested in a single sitting.

Jury Duty, a game about the social dynamics of jury deliberation.
Runners, a game about post-apocalyptic parkour action in a world full of monsters.
Snakegrinder: Misadventures through Time, a game about an 80s hair band that travels through time solving problems and getting into trouble.
The Wicked World, a game about angel PIs who give up their powers so they can hunt down demons on Earth.
I Hit It with My Axe, a game about dwarf barbarians boasting about the great deeds they'll perform, and then having to actually perform them.
Comfort Zone, a setting-agnostic system for quick and very simple RPGs.

193834.name: Mayhem Triple
193834.description:
User Summary

A shooting platformer in which you attack intelligent rabbits.

193835.name: The Music Machine
193835.description:
User Summary

You are a 13-year-old girl who is possessed by a ghost who strangely hopes to kill her. Together you seek to uncover the mysteries of an island, where people have lately been murdered. This game could be thought of as an expansion to The Moon Sliver, as it explains a lot from there, although it does stand alone. The graphics are still monochromatic and the horror is more atmosphere than events.

193836.name: Mystery Masters:  Psycho Train Deluxe Edition
193836.description:
User Summary

Your child disappears on a train and you search, solving puzzles to discover her whereabouts.

193837.name: Delete
193837.description:
From the introduction:

In this game you and a few friends get together in order to role-play out the experiences of someone who has been deleted by God, and is damned to turn into the base components of a human body in a few days time, if they don't find God and ask him or force him to undo it. This can be harder than it seems.

One player will play the Devil, and God, and Everything in between (aka the rest of the world), while the rest of the players will take on these characters who are having their lives shattered

193838.name: Dirty Virgins
193838.description:
User summary:

Characters are built from an Ability with 40 points (essentially, a point pool). The Ability pool is distributed into Reputation and Skill at creation. The game proposes an interesting trade-off between Skills that are useful at the beginning of play but a hindrance at the end of play.

193839.name: Shadows over Normandie: Axel
193839.description: Shadows over Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo, featuring Axel of Devil Pig Games.

193840.description:
The Dragon & Flagon is a tavern world-renowned for its most magical drink, The Dragon. Legend has it that one sip of The Dragon can give a hero wondrous abilities beyond their wildest dreams — but with a tavern full of thirsty adventurers and only one flagon left, things are bound to go wrong. Prepare your magic and grab your weapon because there's only one true objective in this brawl — and it's not just a sip of The Dragon. Only one can win and emerge with the reputation as the greatest fighter ever seen within the walls of The Dragon & Flagon!

The Dragon & Flagon is a game of chaos and mayhem for 2-8 players. Throw mugs, smash chairs, swing from the chandelier, sip from the legendary Dragon Flagon, cast spells, and pull the rug out from under your fellow adventurers as you attempt to build up your reputation and win the day!

Play as one of nine unique characters in a 3D tavern environment that can be set up differently every time. Multiple play modes add even more variety.

Will you leave with the greatest reputation from The Dragon & Flagon?
193840.name: The Dragon & Flagon

193841.name: Never Have I Ever: Expansion Pack One

170274.name: Never Have I Ever: The Card Game of Poor Life Decisions

193841.description:
Relive more of life's funny, embarrassing, and awkward moments with your friends.

Includes 77 play cards, 20 rules cards, 10 blank play cards, and 5 blank rule cards.

193842.description: Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo. Includes two punchboards that introduce new characters.
193842.name: Heroes of Normandie: Kelly's Heroes

193843.description:
Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exlusive promo.

From the publisher:

With this elite unit, the US army is able to face any SS group, or any other bad encounters. Ambush Specialists, these soldiers are also heavily equiped with BAR rifles that provide them with a high suppressive fire power.
193843.name: Heroes of Normandie: Miller's Rangers

193844.description: Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo
193844.name: Heroes of Normandie: Steiner Kampfgruppe

193845.description: Heroes of Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo from Dust Tactics universe
193845.name: Heroes of Normandie: DUSTMod

193846.description: Shadows over Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo
193846.name: Heroes of Normandie: Pointe du Hoc

193847.description: This is an expansion to Shadows over Normandie which brings Section M in to the battle alongside the Long Range Desert Group vs the Black Sun Afrika Corps amidst the desert ruins!
193847.name: Shadows over Normandie: Desert Wrath

193848.name: Alchemy Fusion
193848.description:
The game on the principles of "Alchemy" and "Doodle God." Connect elements to discover new one. To discovery awaits 500 of them. Start from fire, water, earth and air to get a computer, a knight, money, the universe and much more. For your convenience we added two methods for adding elements: a scrollable bar and a full list, tips that you can use when you no longer have ideas and that's all completely free.

Source: The Developer Website.

193849.name: Farmscapes
193849.description:
From the publisher's website:

Help Joe restore his ranch in the brand new game by Playrix! Earn money by selling fresh veggies, juicy fruits, eggs, flowers and honey from his old farm to the townspeople, and spend it on restoring the landholding back to its grandeur and beauty. Breathe in new life into a formerly prosperous farm complete with clucking chickens, mooing cows and buzzing beehives. No need to make this lawn story short - indulge yourself in sun, color and blue summer skies! Get ready for this green-fingered game!

193851.name: ElectroTrains
193851.description:
User summary:

You need to get each train through the proper station(s) before sending them on their way. There are three types of trains: regular, express and freight, all of which move at different speeds. Some need only one station, while others need more than one.

193852.name: Sticknia
193852.description:
From the publisher:
Pick a team. Use the cards to enhance your team, or to sabotage others. Battle to dominate the board and be the last team standing.

user summary:
Start by drafting a squad of six Stick cards, each with it's own attack/defense rating and special ability, then placing their corresponding Stick Markers on the battlefield. Play then goes around the table with each player moving their Stick Markers into position, playing cards to enhance their Sticks or harm their opponent's Sticks, and rolling the dice to resolve battles until only one squad remains on the board.

193853.name: Disaster! (2005)
193853.description:
From the introduction:

The characters of this [game] belong to an isolated community which is going to face a terrible disaster. The magnitude of the disaster threatens to destroy the whole community and no help may be expected from outside, or it may arrive too late.

User summary:

The player characters are assumed to have exceptional abilities (though not "super powers") not shared by most members of the community.

193854.description:
Gnomi is a quick strategy card game about mushroom-farming gnomes for 2-6 players. Steal mushroom cards from other players, and use your gnomes to enact special abilities. Once cards have been used, you flip them up-side-down in your hand. The last player with right-side-up cards in their hand wins.

Gnomi is designed so that you can play anywhere, since your hand is also your discard pile. After dealing, you can keep the decks in your pocket.

Deduction and resource management are needed to win.

Play a quick game while waiting in line, or as a filler at game night. Games take 10 minutes. 2-6 players.
193854.name: Gnomi

193856.name: Zombies Forever
193856.description:
In this game of strategy and control for 2 to 6 players, move your pieces and protect your king to attack and defeat other creatures to win.

Based with triangular tiles on an hexagonal board, the game mechanic is as simple as move and attack. The opponent may retreat unless he is blocked by other pieces or the outside rim. The dead creature is placed in the attacker's pantry. it will be eaten later to increase movement or number of attacks.

193857.name: Chefs: the card game
193857.description:
With a master jumbo card, each player choose 2 menus each turn.
On this card, you will use counters to track your points, stars and available menus.

The game mechanics is based on card drawings which randomly brings customers with different tastes and preferences. If they match, you earn points (dice rolled). Then, you can spend points to invite food critics by drawing food critics cards, if your menu matches, you earn a star.

You win when your restaurant reaches 3 stars.

193859.name: Korlok
193859.description:
Designer's Blurb

Korlok is a gems set in a world which has been forever changed by the Shatterclysm. It is a place of riotous colors, monstrous creatures, and easy death.

193860.name: Forest Warrior
193860.description:
Forest Warrior is a game in which you will have to survive a forest full of evil monsters like zombies, birds and fire spirits. Using weapons as hatchets, guns and explosives you will have to stay alive in increasingly difficult waves.
Besides weapons you are also able to use so called specials. Specials are powerups that can be activated in-game. They vary in duration and function and have a certain power level. The specials are described in the select menu before starting the game.
While in-game you have four specials per run, of which three can be chosen from the select menu whereas the last one (the most powerful one) is locked.
A particular type of specials are “Allies”. Allies can be summoned to back you up while fighting the evil. Examples of allies are the Hawk and the Husky. The Hawk helps clear up birds where the Husky helps you survive evil monsters at ground level.

Source: The Publisher Website.

193862.name: Grand Fleets: Third Edition Rulebook
193862.description:
From the publisher's website:

Grand Fleets is a tabletop game of naval warfare during the age of the battleship. From the ironclads of the late 1800s to the floating fortresses of World War II, players can take command of the ships that altered the course of history.

In addition to the basic rules for surface actions between 1890 and 1950, Grand Fleets includes rules for using submarines and aircraft alongside your battlewagons. Advanced rules are also provided for things like RADAR, smoke screens, critical hits, fleet morale, night fighting, and destroyer flotillas.

All distances in Grand Fleets are given in thousands of yards (kyds), giving you the flexibility to adapt the tabletop scale to whatever size miniatures you have on hand. The rules are also written to accommodate hex-based play, if desired.

The rulebook contains 160 ship data cards representing over 50 different classes. Best of all, you'll never have to wait for official publication of your favorite ships: comprehensive, step by step guidelines are provided to generate game stats for any vessel that put to sea during the battleship era.

So, raise the battle ensign, sound general quarters, and damn the torpedoes — your destiny awaits!"

Grand Fleets: Third Edition Rulebook is a set of naval miniatures rules that can be used for ships from 1:1800 to 1:6000 scale. The system can be played on a tabletop or hexes. Certain aspects of the system have been streamlined for the third edition, such as separate gun mount arcs have been combined and armor piercing values have been reduced from three to one. The rules can be used to simulate naval battles from the Spanish-American War era to WWII. The main rulebook includes scenarios from the Russo-Japanese War, WWI, the Spanish Civil War, and WWII,

193865.name: Numenera GM Intrusion Deck
193865.description:
From the Monte Cook Games website:

The 100-card Numenera Intrusion Deck presents scores of potential GM intrusions. Time to throw a wrench into the player’s carefully crafted plans? Just draw a card—or draw three or four and pick one that works best. You can even use the deck when prepping adventures, to help inspire the intrusions you plan for the encounters you design. The cards are color-coded for combat, interaction, and miscellaneous encounters—just draw the card type that matches the type of scene being played.

193866.name: Numenera Weird Deck
193866.description:
From the Monte Cook Games website:

Numenera is nothing if not weird. And sometimes even the best GM needs a little creative spark to help inspire new, strange things for the game. These cards do just that: Draw a card whenever you feel like it–whether it’s prepping for the next game or right in the middle of a session. There are three ideas on each of the 100 cards in this deck: a simple basis for a weird element, a more developed concept that builds on that basis, and a full-blown idea, complete and detailed. Draw inspiration from any of them to add an element of the weird and unexpected to your Numenera game!

193867.name: 1822: The Railways of Great Britain
193867.description:
1822 is a game in the 18xx series based on the growth of the Railways through the age of steam. It is based on a map of most of Great Britain, excluding north Wales and the Scottish Highlands.

Players take the part of investors in Railway companies and then operate the companies to maximise their own wealth.

The game has several McGuffins...
1. There are private companies, minor companies and major companies (released as concessions in the bidding rounds). These are released in tranches in random order.
2. The bidding mechanism is "Lawsonian" whereby players can bid on a limited number of the companies on offer and all of the bids are resolved simultaneously.
3. A new type of train is introduced: a Local train which runs on its home station.
4. Major companies have historical destinations.
5. Major companies can acquire any minor companies to which they are connected (if the owning player agrees) allowing very flexible and variable game play.
6. There is a strong incentive on players not to spend all of their initial capital in the first stock rounds.

193868.description: The expansion of the board game Medieval Battle. The token of the Commander appears on a battlefield and can fight like the other units but the attendance of the Commander allows also to surprise the opponent by the special command or maneuver.
193868.name: Medieval Battle: The Commander

193870.name: Spazio: 1999
193870.description:
Spazio: 1999 is a game that recreates the space voyages of the Alphans, the stranded inhabitants of Moonbase Alpha, in their search for a course to return to Earth.

The game is inspired by the '70 ITV/RAI English/Italian produced TV series "Space: 1999/Spazio: 1999".

Introduction to the game (translated form the Italian rulebook):
"In the 'Spazio: 1999' game the players must move the Moon on the main Gameboard and visit alien planets with their Eagle spaceships, to conquer the Course cards that will enable them to build, on the Stellar Monitor secondary gameboard, the right Course to return to Earth. The first player able to build a complete Course will win the game".
