193871.description: Munchkin Marvel 2: Mystic Mayhem, an expansion for Munchkin Marvel, lets players journey into mystery with Doctor Strange and The Defenders as they fight villains like the evil Baron Mordo and the Dread Dormammu. This expansion includes new Doors and Treasures as well as twelve oversized Dungeon cards that introduce powerful new threats and Allies and add a new level of mayhem and madness to the game.
193871.name: Munchkin Marvel 2: Mystic Mayhem

193872.description:
Game covers battle of the Quatre Bras, fought against Ney and Wellington during the Waterloo campaign.

Game was published in the magazine "Dragon" as an expansion of the "Waterloo 1815". Contains two scenarios, historical and fictional, with random arrival of the units and possibale usage of the Prussian forces as well as French D'Erlon corps.
193872.name: Quatre Bras 1815

193874.description:
Munchkin Marvel 3: Cosmic Chaos, a cosmic-themed expansion for Munchkin Marvel, allows players to team up with Star-Lord and The Guardians of the Galaxy and take down some of the heaviest hitters in the Marvel Universe, including The Beyonder and Thanos. New Portals transport players to far-flung Dungeon locales like Xandar and Knowhere.

This expansion contains 90 new Door and Treasure cards as well as twelve new Dungeon cards.
193874.name: Munchkin Marvel 3: Cosmic Chaos

193875.name: Far Cry 3 + Far Cry 4 Double Pack
193875.description:
User Summary

Far Cry 3 + Far Cry 4 Double Pack is a compilation of two games in the Far Cry franchise.

193876.name: Jola: Wer lacht zuletzt?
193876.description:
Each player starts with three pigs in his pigpen. The goal of the game is to get rid of the pigs. Movement is determined by two dice and comences on the track of each players color around the game bord ant into the meadow in the center. If at least one of the dice shows an 1 and one of the player's pigs is in a segment of his color, he discards the pig to the meadow, or if a pig is in the color section of another player, it may be put in this players pigpen.

The game ends when the last player gets his last pig onto the meadow. So even if one player is the first to get rid of his pigs, he may still get new ones until the last player ends the game and may himself lose the game.

201913.name: The Daring & the Doomed: The Elder Dooms

193877.description:
Kingdom-building, monster-fighting, food-vending, gold-stealing PIXEL fun for everyone!!

The Daring & The Doomed is a fast-playing, easy to learn card game for the whole family. The print quality and fun pixel art have been a huge hit where we go to play! Now, we need your help to get this cool little game out for more people to enjoy! The game basics can be learned in a minute or so, with rules cards included right in the box. There’s even some special kids rules and drinking game rules to make things even crazier for your table. The starter deck is 144 cards strong! This means you can play 3 or 4 complete games with no repeats! All you need is a few six-sided dice and something to track gold like pennies, M&M’s or tiny plastic goats. Your boxed, shrink-wrapped starter set includes Heroes, Monsters, and Kingdom cards.
193877.name: The Daring & The Doomed

193878.name: CdB Engine: Manual del Director de Juego
193878.description:
Publisher blurb:
El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico duro, realista y considerablemente táctico. Se trata de la versión genérica del sistema de juego que utiliza el juego de rol Walküre, creado también por medio de una financiación colectiva en Verkami.

El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico porque contiene reglas para jugar en todo tipo de ambientaciones, desde medieval fantástico a ciencia-ficción, pasando por ambientaciones de terror, superheróicas, históricas, y a lo largo de sus más de 900 páginas contiene una enorme de cantidad de material ya generado de antemano para que el Director de Juego solo tenga que escoger lo que necesita. Todo el material es, además, 100% compatible con Walküre.

El Manual del Director de Juego proporciona todas las herramientas necesarias para crear más Talentos, Dones y Limitaciones, de tal forma que si hay alguna clase de personaje que no podías crear, puedas diseñarlo de tal manera que esté equilibrado con el resto de juego. Además contiene diversos capítulos sobre el proceso de dirección, desde la parte más narrativa de dicho proceso a la parte puramente relacionada con las reglas, explicando detalladamente los distintos niveles de poder del juego y como equilibrar partidas a lo largo del tiempo, ya que el CdB Engine ha sido creado con la idea de poder hacer campañas muy largas. No solo eso, sino que también contiene todas las reglas necesarias para crear aleatoriamente toda clase de planetas y sistemas solares. Incluye también varios sistemas de creación de Personajes No Jugadores adaptados a los distintos niveles de poder y un sistema aleatorio de creación de criaturas, y además contiene 130 páginas de criaturas y personajes no jugadores de ejemplo.

193879.name: Season 1 Narrative: Phlan
193879.description:
Publisher blurb:

Want a bit of insight into the design process for the D&D Adventurers League? Using Phlan in a home game and want a bit of background information? Then this is for you! Inside, you'll find the narrative used by the Campaign Administrators in developing the Season's storyline as well as:


A brief history of the city
A number of the major organizations within the city and their prominent NPCs
Featured locations inside and around the city itself


These provide a behind-the-scenes look at the materials presented to designers and include material that wasn't utilized in the adventures released through the Season.

193880.name: Season 3 Narrative: Hillsfar
193880.description:
Publisher blurb:

Want a bit of insight into the design process for the D&D Adventurers League? Using Hillsfar in a home game and want a bit of background information? Then this is for you! Inside, you'll find the narrative used by the Campaign Administrators in developing the Season's storyline as well as:


A brief history of the city
A number of the major organizations within the city and their prominent NPCs
Featured locations inside and around the city itself


These provide a behind-the-scenes look at the materials presented to designers and include material that wasn't utilized in the adventures released through the Season.

193881.name: Season 2 Narrative: Mulmaster
193881.description:
Publisher blurb:

Want a bit of insight into the design process for the D&D Adventurers League? Using Mulmaster in a home game and want a bit of background information? Then this is for you! Inside, you'll find the narrative used by the Campaign Administrators in developing the Season's storyline as well as:


A brief history of the city
A number of the major organizations within the city and their prominent NPCs
Featured locations inside and around the city itself


These provide a behind-the-scenes look at the materials presented to designers and include material that wasn't utilized in the adventures released through the Season.

193882.name: CdB Engine: Manual del Jugador
193882.description:
Publisher blurb:
El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico duro, realista y considerablemente táctico. Se trata de la versión genérica del sistema de juego que utiliza el juego de rol Walküre, creado también por medio de una financiación colectiva en Verkami.

El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico porque contiene reglas para jugar en todo tipo de ambientaciones, desde medieval fantástico a ciencia-ficción, pasando por ambientaciones de terror, superheróicas, históricas, y a lo largo de sus más de 900 páginas contiene una enorme de cantidad de material ya generado de antemano para que el Director de Juego solo tenga que escoger lo que necesita. Todo el material es, además, 100% compatible con Walküre.

El Manual del Jugador contiene todo lo necesario para crear prácticamente cualquier personaje que quieras interpretar por medio de diferentes mecánicas como los Talentos, los Dones y las Limitaciones. El manual contiene también las reglas básicas del juego, reglas de curación, una innumerable cantidad de peligros naturales y no tan naturales, sistemas de aprendizaje y experiencia, y el sistema de combate, que es eminentemente táctico y aunque se puede jugar perfectamente sin miniaturas, el sistema ha sido diseñado con la idea de usarlas y el aspecto táctico del juego se beneficia de ello.

193883.name: CdB Engine: Manual de Equipo y Vehículos
193883.description:
Publisher blurb:
El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico duro, realista y considerablemente táctico. Se trata de la versión genérica del sistema de juego que utiliza el juego de rol Walküre, creado también por medio de una financiación colectiva en Verkami.

El CdB Engine es un juego de rol genérico porque contiene reglas para jugar en todo tipo de ambientaciones, desde medieval fantástico a ciencia-ficción, pasando por ambientaciones de terror, superheróicas, históricas, y a lo largo de sus más de 900 páginas contiene una enorme de cantidad de material ya generado de antemano para que el Director de Juego solo tenga que escoger lo que necesita. Todo el material es, además, 100% compatible con Walküre.

El Manual de Equipo y Vehículos proporciona 338 páginas de equipo ricamente detallado y separado por tipos de equipo y por niveles tecnológicos. Además contiene reglas de creación y diseño de toda clase de vehículos, sean terrestres, aéreos, acuáticos o espaciales, y reglas para jugar con ellos. Contiene también un sistema avanzado de informática diseñado para partidas de corte ciberpunk y/o transhumanista. Y mucho más equipo.

193884.name: Brändi Colorado
193884.description:
The players place number tiles on their own and the shared game
board and try to gain the most points possible as a result. They get points on their own game board for horizontal and vertical rows with tiles in four different colours. Equally, the get points for rows with tiles with four identical numbers and tiles of their own colour.

193885.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Learning English - Money or nothing
193885.description:
User Summary

This is a school aid programme that helps kids learn English in the form of numbers 1-20, the alphabet and understanding individual words - all through mini-games and puzzles.

You help Pixeline sort out who inherits Guldbergh before the money falls to the greedy lawyer Naerrig (Stingy).

LEARNING ENGLISH: Money or nothing

Pixeline har brug for hjælp til at løse gåden, om hvem der arver de mange millioner som Guldbergh har efterladt til en hemmelig arving. Hvis du ikke finder arvingen, gåralle pengene til den griske Advokat Næhrrig.

I spillet lærer du på en sjov måde at forstå engelske ord, alfabetet og tallene fra 1-20. Der er i alt hele 11 minispil, der giver en god introduktion af de engelske for begyndere.

Back of the box

193886.name: The Secret Of The Atomic Bomb
193886.description:
The goal of the game is to built an atomic bomb.
The game is played in three phases. In the first phase the players try to collect 4 cards of one country by exchanging cards between neighboring players by the roll of an even number. If a player collects 4 cards of a country he contolls this country and enters phase two.

In the second phase the players move around the game board, starting at their own country. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players. They collect fissionable material (atoms) to build an atomic bomb by placing two atoms on any space he occupies in any country that has entered phase two. If a player has collected 11 atoms, his country enters phase three.

In the third phase the players build an atomic bomb by moving the 11 collected atoms from the white dots inside the factory to the blue dots.

The first player to finish his atomic bomb, wins the game.

The Game was published between late 1945 and 1947.

193887.name: Pixeline: Magi i Pixieland
193887.description:
User Summary

Help Pixeline bring the magic back to Pixieland, where the Pixies have lost their magic and can't, where the Gnomes can't keep order and everyone could really use your help.

So help Pixeline by completing a number of mini-games and puzzles.

Skaf magien tilbage til Pixieland!

Der er sket noget mystisk i Pixieland - Pixierne har mistet deres magi! Gnomerne kan ikke finde ud af at holde orden, og de stakkels feer kan ikke flyve, men også for Pixielands nye beboere er der problemer - og de har virkelig brug for din og Pixelines hjælp!

Back of the box

193888.name: Orion's Gate
193888.description: Orion’s Gate is a space battles wargame from the creative mind of Austin Peasley. The game features an innovative fleet building system that let’s you blow up enemy ships piece by pice. The game can be used to play larger battles (like BFG) as well as dogfights (like X-WING).

193889.name: Pixeline - fuld af fis og ballade
193889.description:
Pixeline must help the horse Horst von Hoofhoof, the moose Fattyfatty and the pretty seahorse Belladona in getting ready for the animal faire.

Play 9 different mini-games of spelling, flags and other fun adventures in 3 difficulty-levels to help Pixeline. You can also play with up to 2 of your friends in the same game.

Pixeline loves to play - do you want to join her?

User Summary

Pixeline skal hjælpe hesten Horst von Hovhov, elgen Tyggisakki og den smukke søhest Belladonna med at blive klar til dyrskuet.

Leg dig til at stave ord i snegleræset, og kør gennem de rigtige ordport. Lær lidt om alverdens sprog og flag, og giv dyrene deres yndlingsretter. Spil slangespillet med Simon og Punjab, og hjælp Simon med at blivestor nok til at danse. Lær at regne sammen med kamelen.

3 sværhedsgrader på alle 9 spil og oplæg til socialt spil, hvor 3 spillere kan spille sammen. Masser af mægtig musik med kendte og nye børnesange.

Er du klar til at hjælpe Pixeline? Hun elsker at lege. Vil du være med?

Back of the box

193890.name: B-Sieged: Sons of the Abyss – Defender Level Kickstarter Rewards
193890.description:
This is a box of goodies that was given to backers of the Kickstarter Campaign.
Extra figures: Elite Gargoh*, sculpted versions of the Avatar of the Abyss* and Ikomoth the Dragon*.
Alternate sculpts: Standard Gargoh, Elite Krohn, Standard Krohn, and Mölen.
Sculpted tokens: First player, morale, food, gold, Divine Grace, Time, Messenger, Alternate Messenger sculpt, protected building, damaged building, destroyed building.
Extra heroes: Thorlak the Barbarian, Astrid the Princess, Donatto the Cook, Dahlia the Peasant, Viggo the Captain, Igor the Quack Doctor, Kirk the Jester, Eivor the Noble, Damiana the Innkeeper, Waldo the Monk*, Kaira the Seer*, Rolf the Executioner*.
Zombicide: Black Plague ID Cards - allows B-Sieged and Zombicide: BP crossover.


These items will be available to non-Kickstarter backers.

193891.name: Pass auf!: Die Gefahren der Straße
193891.description:
Each player starts on one of 6 starting points, has to visit all the other starting points in numerical order and end the game on his own starting point. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces traffic situations hinder or benefit the players, dependent if they are motorists, motor cyclists or pedestrians.
The first player to return to his own starting point wins the game.

This game was likely published between 1912 and 1927.

193892.name: Jordbær Marie og Hendes Venner
193892.description:
This is a Danish game based on the character Strawberry Shortcake.

Do you know Strawberry Shortcake? She is a sweet girl who lives in Strawberryland. She has a lot of friends and in this game you can visit them all.

User Summary

Kender du Jordbær Marie? Hun er en sød og nysgerrig pige, som bor i Jordbærland, i et hus der ser ud som et jordbær. Jordbær Marie har masser af gode venner - og i dette cd-rom spil kan du besøge dem alle sammen.

Back of the box

193893.name: Morten Skildpadde: Morten går i skole
193893.description:
Danish game based on Franklin the turtle.

Join Franklin (Morten) as he goes to school.

There are plenty of things to do.


9 activities
3 difficulty levels
Activities that stimulate creativity and a sense of adventure.
Books and activities that can be printed
Ideas for games to play when you are not in front of the pc.


Help Badger put on a play. Learn to recognise nouns and verbs. Help Franklin sort insects after species, colour and pattern.

User Summary

Tag med Morten Skildpadde i skole.

Der er masser af spændende ting du kan lave i Mortens skole.


9 aktiviteter
3 sværhedsgrader
Aktiviteter der stimulerer kreativitet og opdagelsestrang.
Bøger og aktiviteter der kan printes ud
Idéer til andre lege - når du ikke sidder ved computeren


Hjælp Grævling med at lave et teaterstykke. Genkend navneord og udsagnsord, genkend modsætninger. Hjælp Morten med at sortére krybende, kravlende og flyvende insekter efter art, farve og mønster.

Back of the box

193894.name: Dirty Bomb
193894.description:
London is a post-apocalyptic wasteland with no law and no order, it's time to call in the mercenaries, as you battle it out for riches and bragging rights. Work together or die alone in the most challenging team-based FPS.

YOUR MERCS, YOUR STYLE
Choose from a wide array of distinct Mercenaries, each with a variety of load-outs and attributes to suit your play style.

THERE'S NO I IN TEAM
Success in Dirty Bomb relies on creating balanced Mercenary squads, coordinating with your teammates and showing your opponents the real meaning of hostile negotiations.

COMPETITIVE TO THE CORE
With no aim assist and no hand holding all that lies between you and certain death are your skill and reactions.

Source: The Game Website.

193895.description:
Cards Against IT is a fan-made version of Cards Against Humanity that is designed for Information Technology Professionals. Like the regular game, a player selects a red card with fill-in-the-blank text and each player selects one of their white cards to try and find the funniest result. The person playing the red card chooses the funniest response.

The game can be played independently or integrated with Cards Against Humanity. Unlike the original game, the humor is very tame in nature and is designed to be Safe for Work so it could be played in the office. The cards all relate to funny situations that people who work in Help Desks or other IT fields might encounter.
193895.name: Cards Against IT

193896.name: Pixelines Little Brother - Dents in the Bun Dough
193896.description:
User Summary

Pixelines younger brother (Lillebror) is making trouble again as he wants to help make birthday buns.

Help him and his rat-friend Mumle solve a variety of puzzles in their quest to make those birthday buns.

Så er der buler i bolledejen...

Pixelines Lillebror er igen ude på ballade. Han har denne gang sat sig for at hjælpe Pixeline med at bage nogen lækre fødselsdagsboller.

Lillebror får hjælp af den sjove rotte Mumle, og de to kommer på en masse fantastiske opgaver.

Back of the box

193898.description:
This is a promo (Pack B) for Blood Rage produced specifically for the 2016 Kickstarter campaign for The Dice Tower (season 12).

This adds a new god with the following ability: "Invading Hili's province with any figure, by any means, costs exactly 1 Rage (regardless of any other cost modifications)."
193898.name: Blood Rage: Hili – The Even-Handed

193899.name: Thralls of the Sun
193899.description:
Thralls of the Sun is the first adventure for Blood & Bronze. It features:
- 48 pages jam packed with adventure, set in underground slave tunnels and the ancient caves below them.
- A starting point—the player characters have been enslaved and must escape—that combines universality with specificity to make it just as easily used in both new and existing campains. With very little modification, this starting point also provides a suitable bridge for referees wishing to have existing player characters from another world or age arrive in the Blood & Bronze setting for Sword & Planet-style adventures.
- Multiple dangers and obstacles to navigate, including puzzles, traps, fabulous beasts and competing factions among the slaves, besides the constantly menacing guards under the supervision of their cruel Pit Master Mal-Hara.
- Information on two new covenants the adventurers may enter into, if lucky or desperate enough.
- and more...
(from publisher page, abbreviated)

193900.name: Golem Arcana: Zikia – Tidal Lord
193900.description:
From the publisher:

The Tidal Lord reigns supreme while standing in Water regions on the map. Enemies sharing its region suffer 10 damage each turn, while Allies seeking the Tidal Lord's protection recover 10 health each turn while in its region.

Like the non-elite Fen Lord, the Tidal Lord can slow down enemy units. The Riptide attack reduces enemy movement by 3 for one round, but if it shares a Water region with the Tidal Lord this duration is 2 rounds.

The Tidal Lord can also utilize a Pull attack like its non-elite brother -- but the Churning Sea has the option of targeting Allies, in which case it gains Accuracy and does zero damage. Combined with the Tidal Lord's passive ability, it can either pull enemy Golems to their watery doom, or re-position allies for healing.

193901.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 120 - Aug 1985)
193901.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 120
August 1985

Published as PDF in 2015

Announcement: Winner 1984 Charles Roberts Award for Best Amateur Adventure Gaming Magazine

193903.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 192 - Feb 2016)
193903.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 192
February 2016

Polybagged bundle includes promotional card ("Thrasher Blade") for Ophidian.


Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege
Hack and Slash Games' Ophidian 2035

193904.name: Sumo Revise
193904.description:
Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, it’s super fat guys free-styling!!!
Sumo Revise is a local-multiplayer brawler designed to harken back to the zaniness and replayability of couch-crowding games like Super Smash Bros. and GoldenEye 007, with a splash of silliness of games like QWOP and Surgeon Simulator 2013.
Features:
INSANE, UNPREDICTABLE GAMEPLAY
Struggle to force your friends out of the ring in lightning-fast, ever-changing rounds. Grab power-ups to learn the secret abilities of the sumo masters. Don hats and costumes on the fly to confuse your opponents (and yourself)!
EXOTIC LOCATIONS AND EXTENSIVE CUSTOMIZATION
Battle in seven different arenas in the far reaches of Sumo Land. Sharpen your skills with 12 different modes and gameplay modifiers, including Free-For-All, Capture the Flag, and Bacon. Create and share your own levels and modes for never-ending insanity!
THE PLACE IS CRAWLING WITH SUMOS!
Play with up to 8 players simultaneously, or supplement with AI opponents if you’re feeling lonely.
REALISTIC SUMO PHYSICS?
Unfortunately, since they’re so portly the sumos don’t exactly maneuver well…Move wisely!

Source: The Publisher Website.

193905.name: Pongo
193905.description:
Pongo is a 3D action platformer that combines pogo stick jumps with strategic FPS combat. Grab your Pongo, a tool usable as either a pogo stick or a gun, to obliterate enemies and traverse the vast islands of Flubber. Balance rapid movement and high jumps with challenging combat, hordes of enemies, puzzles and traps at every turn. Grab your Pongo and let the adventure begin!
Features:
Leap through over 45 challenging levels
Obliterate monsters with your Pongo
Avoid deadly traps and slay huge bosses
Solve challenging puzzles and explore islands
Enjoy charming 3D environments
Jam to an exciting, quirky original soundtrack

Source: The Publisher Website.

193906.name: Hearts Blazing
193906.description:
(publisher blurb)

Hearts Blazing is a collaborative, episodic, deck-driven RPG of speculative fiction love and conflict.

After collaboratively generating a speculative fiction setting, players take on the roles of dynamic but recognizable archetypes with hidden motivations. They draw from a randomized deck of “episodes” which prompt collaborative narration RPG scenes using evocative introductions. Players bid archetypal tropes on each episode to secure the keyword awards associated with their motivation. While there is no winner, per se, the character who secured the most of their keywords reveals the post session denouement of their character last, getting last word on plot outcomes.

193907.name: Monsternomicon: Mind Flayers
193907.description:
Potent psionic blasts. Writhing face tentacles. Purple-ish skin, slimy and cool to the touch. Extracted brains. All these things and more help define the term “mind flayer” – but what more are these aberrant creatures? What drives them? Find out within.

This monster supplement provides 5 new creatures:

Alhoon - a mind flayer lich
Brain Golem - a stalwart ally made entirely of discarded brains
Elder Brain - the center of a mind flayer community
Ulitharid - a rare and highly advanced mind flayer
Mind Flayer Vampire - ravenous and bestial, it requires brains and blood to survive
Additionally you will find adventure seeds and a sample sept (lair) map, along with suggested random encounters.

193908.name: MAH!
193908.description:
The abridged card game of the centuries-old game mahjong!

A rummy-style card game based on the classic game of mahjong. Be the first to complete a hand by collecting sets, runs, and a pair. Play to win, but also play to not give up the winning hand!

193909.name: 16 and Pregnant
193909.description:
From the Designer

This is a primarily narrative game which uses some stats to control the action. It is designed for 3 to 5 players and Dr. Drew, who helps to control the action and keep things moving.

193911.name: Ruzh Delta Z
193911.description:
Ruzh Delta Z is a frenzied shoot-em-up which draws inspiration from classics such as Gradius, DoDonPachi, and R-Type. Shoot your way through perilous stages and wreck thousands of rogue vessels in your quest to become the ultimate pilot.
Features:

Intense non-stop shooting action
Bullets, bullets, and more bullets
Nail-biting classic shmup gameplay
Tons of rogue vessels to destroy
Immersive chiptune soundtrack

Source: The Publisher Website.

193912.description:
End of the Line is a game of post-apocalyptic family survival. Your goal is to outlast your opponents as you experience mutant attacks, dehydration, starvation and some of the worst pop culture references the end days has to offer.

In End of the Line, you experience the end times from the perspective of an everyday citizen. With your Dad, Mom, Boy, Girl and Dog your family must stand in line waiting for food, water, fuel, and ammo. Meanwhile, terrible things (played by you and your opponents) are happening trying to make collecting those resources difficult. It's worker placement gone horribly, horribly wrong.
193912.name: End of the Line

193913.name: Dragons of Blood and Water
193913.description:
From the introduction:

Players in Dragons of Blood and Water play three distinct types of entity within the game world – a noble Shaper Family, Scions (members) of that Family, the mud Dragon protector of the Family. Family and Dragon are created before the game proper starts; individual Scions can be created as need arises.

193917.name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Primordial Hunger
193917.description:
Primordial Hunger is a red-green deck built around devour, from Shards of Alara.

Planechase was originally released in 2009. This deck was released in 2012.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase preconstructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.

Planechase 2012 introduced the "phenomenon" card type. A player may have up to two different phenomenon cards in his or her planar deck, which cannot have the same name. When a player planeswalks to a phenomenon, he or she follows the instructions on the card, then immediately planeswalks away from it.

193918.name: UNO: Cinderella
193918.description: Cinderella themed version of standard UNO. One Exclusive Glass Slipper card.

193919.name: Ordo Ab Chao
193919.description:
In this board game the players are not playing against each other. Instead they collaborate and play against the rise of an occult, worldwide dictatorship that is ruled by an evil elite hierarchy. Up to twelve players can participate in the resistance against the rise of evil. By playing the game the players will become informed and mentally prepared to resist the push for a New World Order.

The game is played by throwing a common dice and moving around a board on a path called the path of the astrological ages. Players have a chance of overcoming the rise of the evil hierarchy by answering question cards correctly.

If a player steps on a square marked with the all seeing eye, the evil hierarchy will move up one step on the 'rise of evil ladder'. If on the other hand the player steps on a square marked with an 'I', 'P' or 'M' symbol, the player has the chance of ascending the 'resistance ladder' by answering a question correctly. If the elite moves to the top of its ladder first, the game is lost. If the players manages to move to the top of the resistance ladder first, the game is won.

If you have a printer you can download and print the game.

193927.description:
In Vanuatu, you are a Vanuatuan who wants to prosper during the eight turns of the game. In order to prosper, you have to manage with natural resources, rare items, vatus (local currency) and tourists. To earn money or prosperity points, you may also draw on the sand*, carry tourists all over Vanuatu islands, or trade cargo with foreign countries.

On each turn, the archipelago expands and you have to program your actions with five tokens. You put one or more of them on the chosen action spaces, and on your turn, you will only be able to play an action if you have the majority on its space. Thus, sometimes have to wait for other players to remove their tokens by playing their actions. If you are not in majority anywhere, you have to remove all of your tokens from an action and give up hope of playing this action. A good strategy lets you block other players; for example, they won't be able to sell fishes if they haven't caught them first – order matters! Islands and sea resources are rare, so be quick and take them first!

There is no such thing as a rich Vanuatuan. When you reach ten Vatus, they automatically transform into 5 prosperity points and again, you are poor. Life is hard, but you may encounter ten men to help you; on each turn you choose one of them to increase your benefits from an action. As always, being the first player lets you choose before the others.

In short, Vanuatu is a strategy game of programming and majorities that features development, blocking, and a lot of interaction between players.

This Quined Master Print edition brings you the wonderful original game, as well as the Rising Waters expansion and the extra character of the Governor, with completely new artwork by Konstantin Vohwinkel. The Rising Waters expansion adds a whole new level of tension to the game: Global warming threatens Vanuatu. Many islands are in danger of disappearing under the sea due to rising waters. Players will therefore have to unite to protect the islands by building dikes. However, the interests of one are not necessarily the interests of others.

(*) Sand Drawing in Vanuatu belongs to the Masterpieces of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity of the UNESCO.
193927.name: Vanuatu (second edition)

193928.name: Top Trumps Tournament
193928.description:
This game takes the Top Trumps mechanic, and turns it into a big game.

Try to fill your scorebar first, by winning games from mini Top Trumps games. Spin the spinner to decide which mini-game you play, then spin the spinner again to decide which of the six decks you play the game with - you can use the 6 decks provided, or any of your own decks. Every time you win a game you win one or two pegs, and when someone has filled their bar there is one final minigame of Top Trumps to determine the winner, with each player getting the number of cards equal to their score to play with.

193930.name: Fortress
193930.description:
Fortress is a game in rounds for 2 to 5 players. The concept is to protect royal cards in your hand while trying to capture your opponent’s royals. This is done by placing non-royal cards on the left and right of the royal cards --thus building a fortress. In hand cards are used to break down an opponent's defenses, making the player's own defenses weaker in the process. Protected royals and captured royals are worth points that are tallied after each round.
The game can be played without a table, and only requires a single standard 52-card deck (removing the Jokers).

193931.name: Crossfire
193931.description:
Crossfire is a territory control game that only requires two decks of standard poker cards and a table.
The game involves two players starting at either end of the table making his way towards (and through) his opponent. Cards are setup on the table as a grid that players build upon to reach the other end. Players must maintain a line of "powered" cards to continue moving forward. There is a high level of strategy and tactics to obtain victory.

193933.name: Horse-lords of Rohan
193933.description:
Publisher blurb:

South along the Great River Anduin, beyond the southernmost peaks of the Misty Mountains, lies the land of Rohan. Here dwell the Rohirrim, the swift sons of Eorl who descended from the North centuries ago to settle in the land of Calenardhon. Known also as the Riders of the Mark, they are proud warriors and riders, ready to defend the Free Peoples against the threats arising in the twilight of the Third Age.

Horse-lords of Rohan details the Rohirrim, describing their history and their lands, as well as introducing rules for two new cultures, the Riders of Rohan and the Dunlendings. Also included are rules for handling horses, riding in combat and horse-breeding. As well as the lands of Rohan, this supplement also details the ancient Forest of Fangorn, shedding light on its mysterious inhabitants, the Ents and terrible Huorns; the folk of the Dunland Fells; and the Tower of Isengard and the machinations of the White Wizard, Saruman. It is an indispensable resource for Loremasters looking to take their game into a whole new region.

Ride with the Eorlingas on the plains of Westemnet, enter the Golden Hall of Edoras, and climb the Burg at Helm’s Deep!

193934.description:
The Cat Herding Card Game!

This simple, fast-paced, simultaneous play card game is all about balancing speed and perception.

Players race to be the first to round up 150 cats (points).There are 60 cards with point values ranging from 5-75 in increments of 5. Players try to collect 4 cards of equal value to earn that many points.

All gameplay is simultaneous. The 60 cards are divided evenly among all players so that each player has their own draw pile. At the shout of "Get 'Em" all players quickly draw 4 cards. Players can only hold 4 cards at a time. Players can put cards face up on the table, one at a time. Players can pick up cards, one at a time, Either from their draw pile or any face up card on the table. The first player to have 4 cards with matching point values in hand shouts out "Got 'Em" and scores points equal to the number on the 4 cards. Then all the cards are shuffled and redistributed and a new round begins. The first player to accumulate 150 points wins.
193934.name: Get 'Em

193935.name: The Curse of Antelope Woman

rpg.6687: How We Came to Live Here

193935.description:
from the Bully Pulpit Games website

"Curse of Antelope Woman" is a complete one-shot scenario for Brennan Taylor's excellent game "How We Came To Live Here". Characters and situation for Inside and Outside GMs are provided.

193936.name: Weltkrieg Main Rulebook
193936.description:
Weltkrieg allows you to re-create well-known (and not so well-known) battles from the wars of the 20th Century on your tabletop, and change the course of history! Scaled for Grand Tactical representation (one miniatures base = 1 company of troops), this first book of the Weltkrieg series includes:

The game series rules, divided into Basic, Advanced, and Optional sections for ease of learning;
Rules that cover basic combat mechanics, command attributes and troop quality, the use of specialized troops (artillery, scouts, aircraft and anti-air, etc.), night actions, airborne operations, engineering functions, and more;
Roughly 180 Data Cards containing the game stats for German and Soviet forces on the Eastern Front, 1941-45, plus a dozen pages of unit organizations for both armies, and a special insert containing the game-equivalent TO&E of Panzergrenadier Division Grossdeutschland at the beginning of the 1942 Fall Blau offensive; Five battle scenarios covering actions throughout the war; Seven 'generic' scenarios that can be used for pick-up games, or as the starting scenario for one of two different types of campaign games; Comprehensive game charts, play aids and markers.

Weltkrieg uses a semi-alternating turn sequence that keeps players involved in the game instead of waiting around for their opponent to finish their turn before being permitted to take any actions, and incorporates the use of specific unit orders and Command Points that may be expended to perform certain game functions; formations having better command and control will be able to accomplish more during an average game turn than those with lesser force coordination.

Written primarily for 6mm and smaller figure scales, Weltkrieg can accommodate figure scales up to 15mm with minimal rules modifications.

The Basing seems compatible with Flames of War so this gives an alternative to use with your 15mm miniatures.

Case Blue Free Demo version is available.

193937.description:
The Worst Type Of Person is an adult party game that lets players amuse each other with their humor and creativity.

In this entertaining game, players use one of the descriptive cards in their hand to create the funniest person they can by matching it to a person on a card.

Players choose from their hand a description on a card to make the funniest and most ridiculous, ludicrous, absurd, inappropriate, preposterous, and and “worst type of person” they can. Then all of the players discuss why their choice, or another players choice is the “worst”.

Players decide which other player they think made the “worst person”, and award them their played card. The player with the most awarded cards at the end of the game wins.

Players will have fun playing their cards and laughing at the cards other players play. But the most fun comes from the hilarious discussions players will have about their choices.

The description on your card may not seem to be the worst at first, but a clever or creative explanation can make your description the worst.

Making funny matches with the cards is entertaining, but the group discussion of everyone’s choices is where the game really becomes fun.

The games are fairly short if played for only 1 or 2 rounds. With short games, players can more easily leave or join the game. Short games also allow other players to join in easier.

The Worst Type of Person is available in 2 volumes at The Game Crafter for $19.99 each.
193937.name: The Worst Type Of Person

193938.name: Quickstart Rules & Adventure (Robert E. Howard's Conan)
193938.description:
From the "What's in This Quickstart Guide?" section:

Here in this preview of the upcoming roleplaying game from Modiphius is everything needed to begin to adventure in the world of Conan. This booklet begins with a brief overview of the Hyborian Age setting, and contains a summarized version of the 2d20 rules system. Next are a number of pre-generated characters for use by the players, and finally, To Race the Thunder is a short adventure full of harrowing danger in the Pictish Wilderness, a battle that only the boldest will survive!

193939.name: Fight Sphere
193939.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game all start with homogeneous abilities - they are gladiators with a starting dice pool of five dice. Any narrative development that transpires makes them unique, however it does not influence their abilities. The game involves the players deciding to work together or at cross purposes. If needed, the game master will use non-player characters as opponents. Opposed actions are resolved with a system of dice pool wagering.

193940.name: The Dark, Romantic, Extraordinary Adventures of Mary Sue

rpg.34090: The Dark, Romantic, Extraordinary Adventures of Mary Sue

193940.description:
from the core rules

The Dark, Romantic, Extraordinary Adventures of Mary Sue (DREAMS) is a game about a specific kind of Mary Sue story. Go to a local bookstore and you’ll likely find them in the pages of books sorted as Paranormal Romance, Teen Fantasy, or Urban Fantasy. These Mary Sues live in a world just removed from our own; where vampires and faeries live in the shadows and our darkest nightmares lurk around every corner. But not all of the monsters are really nightmares. Some might be, but the rest are just misunderstood. Some may even be Mary Sues themselves!

All the above serves merely by way of introduction. You don’t really need me to tell you any of this because you already know it. The character you create for this game is the most beautiful rainbow ever to grace the sky.

193941.name: In the Beginning... (2005)
193941.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are atypically abstracted, being things such as beliefs, a mythos, or similar. Character creation involves drawing iconography which is circulated around the table, gaining additions on the way. The page of icons then returns to the initial player who abstracts traits from the images and assigns these traits to card suits. The game is played as a series of wagers based on card hands drawn from individual packs of stripped French cards. The principle goal of the game is for the player's character (e.g., iconography) to gain narrative ascendance among the others.

193942.name: Vampire: The Dark Ages Storyteller's Screen (20th Anniversary Edition)
193942.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring the beautiful collage of Vampire: The Dark Ages (20th Anniversary Edition) art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier.

193943.name: ∞
193943.description:
User summary:

The game presents a surreal setting to the characters. In most games, characters will not meet other characters but may interact with non-player characters. The rules suggest these disparate adventures are best handled by the game master rapidly switching from one character scene to the next. Action resolution is performed by opposed dice pool rolls; modifiers are potentially used and increase in significance as the game develops.

193944.name: Legends of Ryllia
193944.description:
user summary

"Legends of Ryllia" is a d6-based RPG in a high-fantasy setting.

193945.name: Material World
193945.description:
From the game document:

[Once] you've got vibe, take it to a mythical 1985 Los Angeles, California. The game is set in the 80's because all those crazy branding and P.R. techniques you should be thinking about were mostly formulated in the mid 80s. People were generally not aware of them yet, and they were used in much more clumsy and obvious ways. The game is set in Los Angeles because it is a nerve center of America’s media.

193946.description: In Quantum Link, 2 players take turns placing their dice on empty spaces of the board with a fixed face value, betting on how many friendly dice will surround each of them at the end of the game. Quantum Link is the evolution of Quantum Leap and Adaptoid, by the same designer.
193946.name: Quantum Link

193947.name: Eye for an Eye
193947.description:
Rise of the Occulites: Arena is a game of fast and furious, tactical, arena combats... in real time. Five minutes for a single round, an hour for a full tournament.

Set in the Rise of the Occulites universe, Rise of the Occulites: Arena utilises the new ARTS system (Arena Real Time Skirmish) developed by Darwin Games to produce an intense and exciting tabletop experience.

In Rise of the Occulites: Arena, players take control of a single combatant in a real time fight to the death. Each round is played to a soundtrack that goes for no longer than five minutes, with the best of three rounds winning. Rise of the Occulites: Arena is played in real time. There are no turns, it is constantly every player’s turn. The frantic positioning and the back and forth attack and defence of characters is controlled by speed rolling, quick decision making and dice allocation. Players roll and reroll dice, allocating what they want without waiting for other players.

193948.description:
Fans of the classic naval wargames War at Sea and Victory in The Pacific have for many years combined the two into an ad hoc simulation of the global naval struggle that was World War II. There were issues, however: a wide variety of house rules, battle resolution that drastically changed depending on the sea area in which it took place, to say nothing of numerous historical "anomalies". Now these two games have been reimagined, re-researched, and recombined into a single seamless contest for either two or four players. This ain't your Daddy's War At Sea.

Can the Royal Navy protect the shipping lanes of Britain's far-flung empire long enough to turn the tide against the U-boats? Or will the Kreigsmarine and Supermarina cut England's merchant marine lifeline? Will the French remain loyal to the Allies, or will they bring to life Churchill's greatest nightmare and fight alongside the Germans? Can the Americans withstand the Japanese onslaught long enough to bring their mushrooming strength to bear? Or will Japan complete its conquests in the Pacific and force the Allies to negotiate for peace?

Among the new features

1. A movement & combat system consistent over both the Atlantic and Pacific

2. All ships evaluated uniformly

3. Redesigned counters

4. Added sea areas including a completely new Atlantic map

5. More emphasis on U-Boats

6. Designed from the start as a single game

New Rules Require New Tactics:
Players employing "classic" strategies may quickly find themselves in trouble. Atlantic Jutland-esque battles are replaced with a tense balancing act: Only patrolling ships can combat U-Boats, but raiding ships are needed to prevent German surface raiders. An IJN pressing the early edge too hard may be met with Atlantic Fleet reinforcements, making a Hawaiian invasion more realistically difficult.
193948.name: Victory At Sea Redux

193949.description:
Boldly go where no one has gone before. In Star Trek: Ascendancy — a board game of exploration, expansion and conflict between the United Federation of Planets, the Klingon Empire, and the Romulan Star Empire — you control the great civilizations of the Galaxy, striking out from your home worlds to expand your influence and grow your civilization. Will you journey for peace and exploration, or will you travel the path of conquest and exploitation? Command starships, establish space lanes, construct starbases, and bring other systems under your banner. With more than 200 plastic miniatures and 30 star systems representing some of the Star Trek galaxy's most notable planets and locations, Star Trek: Ascendancy puts the fate of the galaxy in your hands.

The great unknown lies before you; with every turn is a new adventure as your ships explore new space systems, encounter new life forms and new civilizations, make wondrous discoveries, and face challenging obstacles, all drawn from the vast fifty year history of Star Trek. Will you brave the hazards of Rura Penthe to harvest vital resources, race to develop Sherman's Planet before your rivals stake their claim, or explore the mysteries of the Mutara Nebula on an ever-growing, adaptive map of the galaxy. With an infinite combination of planets and interstellar phenomena, no two games of Star Trek: Ascendancy will ever play the same!
193949.name: Star Trek: Ascendancy

193950.name: Personally Incorrect: Red Expansion
193950.description:
From the publisher:

Our designers have done it again! Reaching into the most horrendous and disgusting parts of their minds and the internet to bring you our first expansion!

One player reads a Question Card out to the group, replacing "Insert Name" with the name of a person at the table.

The other players then pick a highly-offensive answer card from their hand to give to the reader. The reader then reads the card again, one-by-one, filling in the blanks vwith the provided answers.

Once everyone is done p******* their pants laughing, players then vote on the answer they want to win! No dictator B.S. here; every one of the terrible people playing the game gets a say!

193951.name: Tibia
193951.description:
Tibia is a massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) created by CipSoft. It is one of the oldest MMORPGs and was considered most noteworthy in its early years; however, with the development of MMORPGs, its popularity has grown much slower than other MMORPGs. It was first released in January 1997. It is a free game which is open to the public, though players have the option to pay a fee in order to upgrade to a premium account, granting special in-game benefits, including additional areas to explore, access to vocation promotions, and extra spells.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tibia_%28video_game%29 Tibia (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

193952.name: Warhammer 40,000: Deathwatch - Tyranid Invasion

videogamehonor.34530: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee

193952.description:
User Summary:

The Deathwatch are the elite of the elite. Players control a Kill Team of five Space Marines to fend off a Tyranid invasion. In this turn-based strategy game, each marine has a number of action points (similar to the Space Hulk board game or the old 1993 video game, but most familiar to Rodeo's previous iPhone/iPad release, Warhammer Quest). Marines use action points to move, shoot or go on overwatch. Setting up overwatch and lanes of fire is crucial as the player moves the Kill Team to each mission objective, often through narrow, twisting corridors. Marines gain xp which may be spent on abilities, traits, and stats. Players can use loot drops at the end of missions to customize marine weapon loadouts.

193953.description:
Mistfall: Heart of the Mists is is a fully cooperative card-based adventure game set in a world of mystery, eldritch powers and perilous adventures. Heart of the Mists continues the story of Mistfall in a standalone expansion featuring new Heroes, Enemies, Encounters and Quests, and introducing Allies, as well as alternative versions of some of the base game mechanisms.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, as well as a set of upgrades that can be added directly to a player’s hand during the game. A semi-randomly created board makes for a different landscape every time the game is played, and randomized sets of encounters and enemies create different challenges for players to face before their time runs out.

Mistfall: Heart of the Mists introduces more of what made Mistfall great, making it a good entry point for new gamers, as well as a solid expansion for existing fans. With next to no elements replicated from the base set, Heart of the Mists is the perfect addition to the existing Mistfall set – and a challenging experience both solitaire, as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to go to the smoldering heart of the unrelenting Mists!
193953.name: Mistfall: Heart of the Mists

193955.name: Casus Belli (v4, Issue 16 - Sep/Oct 2015)

rpgissuearticle.177761: Aide de jeu pour les mini-aventures: il était une fois...

193955.description:
(Translated) from the cover

-Iron Kingoms | Rushmore | Alkemy
-The collector editions
-Interview: Maxime Chattam & Monsieu Phal
-Vigilante City: a complete game universe for CO Modern
-Scenarios: Pathfinder/D&D5, CoC, Shaan, Skull & Bones, Polaris 3, Chroniques Oubliées

193956.name: Wulin: Chroniques du Pinceau & de l'Epée

rpg.34096: Wulin: Chroniques du Pinceau & de l'Epée

193956.description:
User Summary

This is the core rulebook.

Wulin - Chronicles of the brush and the sword is a French RPG to play Chinese adventure like Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon or stories or flying dagger, etc.

You play a Youxia, a nomad adventurer in search of justice or fighting the Song Dynasty corruption in 12th century China.

You need 8d8 to play.

193957.name: Quarantine D.O.A.
193957.description:
You are all workers in a Top-Secret underground corporate research facility of D.O.A. (Dynamic Oscillating Architecture) when all of a sudden the quarantine alarm sounds. You know what that means. The "Cleaners" are on their way. You only have so much time to get what you need and be where you need to be to enact your plan or else they will "take care of" you. Don't let anyone get in your way.

Each game of Quarantine D.O.A. will be played on a selfishly player made map that will change every game. With a large selection of special room cards all with unique conditions to randomly choose from, no one will know what will be placed until the map is complete.

Players will take turns spending actions trying to find the items required to enact their plan. Those that succeed will win. There can always be multiple winners but you don't really know who might help and who will get in the way so to be safe don't trust anyone. Search, steal and push to ensure that you are one of the lucky few, but remember, sometime the no one escapes and the "Cleaners" win.

193958.name: Within

rpgissuearticle.162262: Within: L'horreur dans tous ses états

193958.description:
User Summary

This is the core rulebook for the RPG Within

Within is an horror RPG to recreate the ambiance of horror movies and series in the 20th century and onward up to a near future.

This universe is not meant to be realistic but rather an alternative world close to ours, with all the tropes that TV and movies reuse. The GM will be deciding what's happening and what's not.

193959.name: Les Trésors du dernier Millénaire

rpgissuearticle.162258: Les trésors du dernier millénaire: fouet, chapeau et pistolet laser

193959.description:
(Translated) from publisher

Les trésors du dernier millénaire (the Last Millenium treasures) is the 8th expansion for Metal Adventures. It present the mysteries and the dangers of the mythic treasure hunts. Lost planets, ancient artificats for formerly flourishing empires and long forgotten, monsters and robost are amongst the surprises that are waiting for you in that sourcebook.

193960.name: Dojo Defense
193960.description:
Defend the walls of your Dojo from invading Pirates that want to steal the ancient artifact of great power you protect. Play one of six ninjas all with their own special abilities and work together to prevent the fall of the dojo.

This is a worker placement tower defense co-operative game where the Ninjas take turns fighting off wave after wave of Pirates until they have defeated four of six Pirate Captains. Build and upgrade walls to slow down their advance because if they enter the Dojo they will start damaging the Ninjas instead of just the walls and turrets. You can always use bombs and ballistas but you only have have a limited number to use.

Each end phase the Pirate ships will attack with their cannons and send in reinforcements. The location of that attack and the direction and number of new pirates is randomly selected by three small decks of cards that will be reshuffled every time a captain is found. The difficulty of the game can be changed by adding or subtracting to the Pirate number deck.

193961.name: Informants
193961.description:
Thick as thieves they say but what happens when informants infiltrate your thieves' guild? What happens when they are your friends?

Informants is a strategic game made for 2 to 6 players. Compete with and against other players in an effort to collect all of the items you have been tasked to collect. Trade, steal and bluff your way to completing your mission but be careful helping out the wrong team could lose you the game. All you can trust is their word.

Players take the role of either a thief or an informant and are tasked with recovering a number of items.

Each turn you must decide between collecting tools to aid in your mission, trading with another player or attempt a robbery. The round ends when one player collects all of the items they have been tasked with collecting. Players are then rewarded with money for every item they have collected and the winning team is awarded bonus cash for completing their mission. The game ends after all rounds have been played and the player with the most money wins.

193962.name: Shade: La Danza delle Ombre
193962.description:
User Summary

This is the core rulebook.

Shade - La Danza delle Ombre is a swash buckling in Stélénia, a universe inspired by Italian renaissance.

Players' characters are tenebrosis, exceptional beings, whose living shadows are controlled by the game master.

The action is card driven, where the players add an attribute, a skill and the card they draw from a regular 52 cards deck.

193964.name: Atlantis: The Lost Empire – The Great Adventure
193964.description:
Who will manage to get first into Atlantis?
To achieve this, players will have to travel across the dangerous underground river in order to get supplies and get into the lost empire. But watch out! The titans are lurking.

Players roll the die and move on the board accordingly. When a player lands on a block with a picture, draws a card from the "direction cards". When a player collects the 3 special cards needed, he can open the gate of Atlantis. Then, he chooses and flips one out of the seven cards from the center of the board. If the card shows Atlantis, the game is over and the player is the winner. Otherwise, the game continuous until a player finds the card with Atlantis.

211942.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Compendium Volume 2 Modern Era

193965.description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical’s System Demo Version 4.1 (v4.1) Modern Era edition. This demo uses the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Jeff Lewis, Lead Developer of the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

The demo comes with a basic printed rule book, printed map with extra large hexes, one scenario and seventy 1” counters to help you get into one of the easiest tactical systems available. Everything you need to try out LnLT is here.

The Modern Era Edition takes you to Vietnam in 1969, where you can play either the US Army or the Viet Cong forces.
193965.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical System: Modern Era 1960-Present Demo

193966.name: Lock N Load Tactical System  Demo: World War 2 Era 1930-1959
193966.description:
Lock ’n Load Tactical’s System Demo Version 4.1 (v4.1) World War II Era edition. This demo uses the latest set of guidelines and regulations for the game system written by Jeff Lewis, Lead Developer of the Lock ’n Load Tactical Series.

The demo comes with a basic printed rule book, printed map with extra large hexes, one scenario and seventy 1” counters to help you get into one of the easiest tactical systems available. Everything you need to try out LnLT is here.

The World War 2 Era Edition takes you to Normandy 1944, where you can play either the US forces or Germans.

193967.name: Battaglia Spaziale
193967.description:
Battaglia Spaziale "simulates" a tactical "man-to-alien" scale fight beween Space Monsters and Human Space Legion troops, using a checker-like mechanism. The player pieces can eliminate the adversary figures by moving on their squares to capture them.
The game uses 32 soft plastic 2" figures form the "Gli Spaziali" toy soldiers series produced by the same Atlantic.

193968.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 88 - Feb 2016)
193968.description:
Get Ready for the End Times!

All it'll take is a computer glitch in a lead-lined silo, and the apocalypse could be upon us! This month's Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - looks at what comes next, with post-apocalyptic goodies that will be invaluable to gamers using GURPS Action, GURPS Zombies, or the forthcoming GURPS After the End. The end times begin in style with the following lore:


"The Redeemers," a powerful gang that can be friend or foe, from Assistant GURPS Line Editor Jason "PK" Levine. Discover their code of conduct and tenets, along with GURPS stats for various members. This feature also provides maps from Matt Riggsby, scribe and cartographer for GURPS Locations: Hellsgate, plus a player's handout to set the mood.
"Post-Apocalyptic Guns," a GURPS guide to the weapons of the wastelands from GURPS Gun Fu co-authors S.A. Fisher and Hans-Christian Vortisch. Brandish an heirloom weapon with pride, reload using salvaged goods, or even invent new guns!
"Warlords of the Apocalypse," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Mass Combat author David L. Pulver. Learn how to use Mass Combat to tackle some big battles amid a war-torn tomorrow - and pit the two included post-apocalyptic armies against each other . . . or the heroes!
"Better Improvised Weapons," a short-and-sweet look at wielding anything you can grab, by GURPS Martial Arts co-author Peter V. Dell'Orto. Use the rules, options, and perks to get the edge you need in life-or-death situations.
"Nuclear Legacy," a reflection on radioactive woes that may be lurking amid the ashes. GURPS Reign of Steel: Will to Live author Roger Burton West offers a systemless look at nuclear waste, ancient bombs, decontamination, and more.


This issue also includes a high-speed vignette from Matt Riggsby set in the new Car Wars universe, a Random Thought Table that looks at how to keep the apocalypse under control, and other goodies you'll enjoy like there's no tomorrow. The end times may be almost here, but - with this issue - the fun is just beginning!

- Publisher's description

193969.name: A Way to Disintegration
193969.description:
User Summary:
Adventure Module for D&D Next edited for Lucca Comics and Games convention.

193970.name: Un Filo di Ruggine sul Ceppo

193972.name: Hypt
193972.description:
Hypt is a Single-Player Action Arcade game.
Technology has advanced, and a new world of information has been revealed. Mankind knows it as the Internet, but locals know it as Hypt. A world that is now overrun by viruses, trojans, and other forms of malware. Take control of a revolutionary new anti-malware program and explore a vibrant and labyrinthine digital world. Get to the end of each level equipped with nothing except the ability to turn the virus’ deadly powers against them. Take back the digital world in this stylized but lethal test of skill against dozens of levels, hundreds of enemies, and difficult bosses.

Features:
120 challenging levels
Difficult, dynamic bosses
Original soundtrack by the talented Efe Tozan
A variety of enemies to destroy
Hours of immersive gameplay
Gorgeous worlds and digital environments
Fluid 2D top-down mechanics
Intuitive Controls

Source: The Publisher Website.

193973.name: Junk In My Trunk
193973.description:
Junk In My Trunk is a casual game based on the classic Swedish card game Vändtia.

The circus grounds are a mess after a great show. Clean up duties fall to the elephants, and using their trunks like vacuums, they suck up all the junk. The first player to get rid of all of their "Junk" (cards) wins. Special action cards also add to the fun by allowing you to peek, swap and flip.

193974.name: DungeonUp
193974.description:
DungeonUp is a dungeon crawler in which you have to make choice in every few steps.
Inspired by but different from Tower of the Sorcerer, DungeonUp is based on procedurally generated levels so you will encounter a whole new set of challenges in every re-run. This is a must-have for rogue-like and puzzle game fans.

Features:
50+ levels in 5 zones with different monsters and theme.
10+ levels with secrets and plots.
40+ monsters, and some are with special abilities.
In each zone there’s a boss battle, requires you to fight with wisdom.
40+ unique items, and some are designed with puzzles.
Oryx’s 16-bit Fantasy Sprite Set.
3 difficulty levels, designed for both casual and hardcore players.
Maze Mode for your coffee break.
Explore more fun from tons of Player Maps.

Source: The Publisher Website.

193975.description:
This expansion pack introduces "bounties". There are two ways to have a bounty placed on your head.

Firstly, when you fail an Adventure, instead of taking a Failure card, you may take an appropriate Bounty card. Taking a Bounty card this way means you avoid the immediate penalties of failure, which can be quite an advantage. Secondly, you may succeed at one of the several new Adventures included in the expansion, that while lucrative, are a little bit shady, and also "award" you with a Bounty card.

Also included in the expansion are Bounty Adventures. These are adventures that players may go on to claim bounties placed on other players heads -- to bring them to justice, if you will. Claiming a bounty rewards the player claiming it, and incurs a penalty on the player that had the bounty on them. If you get to the end of the game without a bounty on your head being claimed, you have succeeded in avoiding your dark past being unearthed.

And as a successful bounty hunter, you will add to your Legend.
193975.name: Legends of the American Frontier:  Expansion Pack #1 – Bounties of the American Frontier

193976.description:
Poison Bottles is a card game with many classical elements entwined. Each player has a 3x3 grid of facedown cards in front of them, for which they will try to secretly change as the game progresses in hopes to achieve the lowest score possible.

There are five distinct phases in the game, starting with trick taking, where a high card of the first played suit will win. If a poison bottle is played in the trick, the rules are reversed and the low card wins.

In the next two phases, peeking and swapping, every player is allowed to look at any one card on any players board, followed by the losers of the trick swapping one card from their board with a card from their hand. A marker is then placed on one card of each players board to protect it from being attacked.

The attacking phase follows, where the winner of the trick then takes a card from an opponents board, and swaps it with one from his hand, leaving the card face up for the rest of the game. This is repeated for each opponent.

The final phase is the drawing phase, where players draw back up to a five card hand. These phases are repeated until a player cannot draw a card, upon which the game ends immediately. Players then reveal their boards and count up their points, however, if a player manages to get three of the same number card in a row or column, that row is eliminated and now worth 0 points. Similarly, if a player manages to get a row or column of three poison bottles, that row or column becomes worth -30 points. Poison bottles played in the trick taking phase are worth -3 points to that player at the end of the game.

There are elements of hearts, nines, and memory in the game, with a focus on bluffing and heavy player interaction.
193976.name: Poison Bottles

193977.name: Chickamauga: Bloody September, 1863
193977.description:
Chickamauga: Bloody September, 1863 (CBS) is volume four of Paul Koenig’s Bloody Civil War Series. It is a two-player wargame simulating the second bloodiest battle of the war and the biggest defeat for the Union in the West. As the Confederate player, you are in the rare position of outnumbering your enemy. On the first day you must take Thomas' initial blow, and then knock him back, setting up for
the decisive battle on Day 2 after the arrival of Longstreet. As the Union player, you must hope that Thomas can be the Rock of Chickamauga once again. Your army arrives slowly, and you will be hard pressed to hold back the Rebels.

193978.name: The Rifter (Issue 73 - Feb 2016)
193978.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rifter® #73 Highlights:

Rifts® – Nexus Born, by Julius Rosenstein – “official” source material. Why is it that some children born at a ley line nexus are gifted? Find out, and find out exactly what these gifts are and how they can impact player characters and NPCs. New concepts, NPCs and adventure source material. Additional text and ideas by Kevin Siembieda.
Palladium Fantasy RPG® – Children of the Forest, by Kevin Siembieda – “official” source material. More insight about the Wolfen and Faerie Folk of the Great Northern Wilderness. Plus a new villain, new monstrous war steed, magic weapons and an adventure set in the Palladium Fantasy world that lets you use all of this data and new toys.
Splicers® – I am Legion, Part Two, by Charles Walton II, Chris Kluge and Lance Colley – “official” source material. The adventure continues as your heroes must deal with the plight of contending with the new Machine personality known as Legion. In this adventure, the player group is given instructions from the Warlord, himself, to learn more about this enemy, and if possible, use a special weapon to bring it down. But nothing ever works that easy. New War Mounts, O.C.C. upgrades, NPCs, and more, including the very first time a Splicer Warlord is ever statted out.
Dead Reign® – Detroit, by Thomas Morrison – “official” source material (tentatively official). The title kinda says it all. The city of Detroit and its suburbs in the Zombie Apocalypse. An adventure setting plus a couple of new zombie variants.
Palladium Fantasy RPG® – the Triumvirate Dragon by Glen Evans and Kevin Siembieda – “official” source material. For the first time, the iconic three-headed dragon that appeared on the original cover of the Palladium Fantasy RPG is described and statted out.
News, coming attractions, product descriptions and more.

193979.name: Folded
193979.description:
Folded is an abstract origami themed card game for two players. The play area consists of four stacks of cards in the center of play representing squares of origami paper to be "folded" to make creations.

The game comes with many creation cards, each with four steps to complete a creation. These steps must be found in order by flipping cards in place to reveal the steps in sequence and complete chosen creations.

Players move clockwise around four locations using balloon markers to fulfill journey task cards. These journey task cards simply show the symbol that must match the category when chosing the four creations. Players may force their openent to use a differend search method from four fold reference cards to hider their search.

The first player to complete all four creations is declared the winner.

Folded has brightly colored cards in this print and play game that can be played by many ages. It is also compact enough to fit in a mint tin to bring anywhere.

193981.name: Downfall
193981.description:
In the year 2213 the world order, as it had been known for a century and a half, came to an abrupt end over a 19 day war. The bombs started falling on the 3rd day, and by the 19th day ninety-nine percent of the earth’s population was dead or would be soon. Wars and conflicts had raged now and again for decades prior, populations rising up, and the global government seeking to quell the conflict and maintain the status quo. But in the most recent 5 year period, the conflicts escalated rapidly, and the world order began to come apart—leaders became scared and trigger fingers twitchy. No one knows who pressed the button first, and in the harsh realities of the world that followed, no one cared. What mattered was surviving and, if possible, rebuilding.

Each turn, players will draft and simultaneously play a card from their hand ("pack") to indicate their action for the turn. This may be moving citizens or airships to explore or expand around the modular board, building structures, researching technology, initiating conflict, producing or gathering resources, and abating radiation. All of these things can earn you points in different ways. If you cannot store resources, they are left on the ground and are available for anyone present to use. Each card has an action and a lesser version of another action, so you're never stuck being entirely unable to do a particular thing, and you can also store cards for future.

Once all actions are complete, hands are passed to the next player and a new card is added to each one. If a "Winter" card is added, it is discarded and replaced, and the game timer advances. As the game timer advances, both expected events (spread of radiation, combat, feeding your citizens) and unexpected events may occur. When the Winter track reaches the end, the game is over, and points are scored.

193982.name: Fifth Edition Urban Fantasy Races
193982.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fifth Edition Urban Fantasy Races is a collection of races for use with the OGL SRD 5.0 system, collected in an RTF file, as well as a .pdf for quick, easy reference. These documents have been stripped of any product identity and all text included in the download is Open Game Content.

This document includes twelve races and two new human subraces that are compatible with the 5.0 SRD modified with an eye toward use in a modern horror or urban fantasy setting. All information has been adapted from supplements created for the Contagion roleplaying game.

These documents are presented without accompanying art, without formatting or borders, in a fully editable RTF file for use by GMs to reconfigure, modify or print, or for other publishers to incorporate into their own publications in accordance with the OGL.

Some of the abilities within this document may reference spells, classes, races and game elements not included in these pages. These may be found in the Contagion line of roleplaying games and may also be included in future OGL collections from Aegis Studios.

193983.name: In the Wake of Rage
193983.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the Rage of Demons ends and the threat of the demon lords is addressed, how have the Forgotten Realms changed? During their time in the Underdark, the demon lords and their servants unleashed great chaos and horrific destruction. Villages fell, alliances shattered and numerous societies of the Underdark were rattled to their core. Though the demon lords may have been returned to the Abyss, the ramfications of their rage shall be felt for ages to come. In the Wake of Rage explores some ways the Forgotten Realms may have been warped by the Rage of Demons.

In the Wake of Rage contains:

Muck Dwarves: A new dwarven subrace
Tiefling Expansion: New rules for abyssal tieflings and uniqie tieflings
Class Options: 1 new Paladin order and the Oath of the Orphaned, A new Warlock sorcerous origin: Faerzress Taint, New Warlock Patrons: Lolth and Zuggtmoy
New Toolset: Inquisitor's Tools
Makeshift Equipment rules
Feats: Two new feats: Ambush Tactician and Cavern Crawler
Epic Boons: Two new epic boons: Boon of Shared Life and Boon of Wanderer's Fortune




Expand your Underdark adventures In the Wake of Rage!

193984.name: The Fighter Unbound
193984.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting the re-imagined Fighter. Taking the lessons learned from other core products, the Fighter Unbound offers a fully customizable martial character who remains true to the concepts presented in the original class whose abilities have been amped up to match some of the newer class mechanics that have developed since the original class released.

In addition to the class itself the archetype has been revamped, presenting over twenty roles based on many of the original archetypes as well as a few new ones as well. Roles encompass the same function as archetypes but the unbound fighter is not restricted to just one. New feats are also included for use with the unbound fighter.

193985.name: Assembly of the Gods
193985.description: Trick tacking and set collection game where collecting the most pairs of gods is the goal before running out of cards. Played with a 72 card deck with 18 different gods from ancient Greece.

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

193986.name: The Carnival of the Damned
193986.description:
From publisher blurb:

A band of villagers are trapped in a mist-shrouded carnival in the dead of night, facing death at every turn. Can they survive twisted oddities like the corpse-filled Tunnel of Love and the dreaded Bone Coaster?

Filled with fantastic art, the Carnival of the Damned unleashes nightmares into any campaign, with encounters refined and polished by the anguished screams of hundreds of players at conventions like Dragon Con and Gary Con!

For judges, the adventure fills many needs: author David Baity has crafted over 30 encounters and dozens of random threats. There is enough content for days of tournament play, or judges can select a smaller collection of favorite dangers for a quick DCC funnel session. For sandbox-style play, judges can extract individual encounters whenever a twisted challenge is needed in any old school system. There's even a haunting backstory for those looking to integrate the adventure into an extended campaign.

And there’s clowns. Lots and lots of clowns.
